description:
So last night I was hungry but not super hungry. Which meant I didn't want something super heavy. As I'm trying to think if something to eat sushi pops up in my head. I think to myself that sounds bomb.com right now. Its about 10pm mind you so I start looking for sushi places on yelp thinking I would be out of luck. I came upon sushi raw and. saw that they were open till midnight which is rare and I was pretty excited about that! I start looking at the review and to be quite honest they're a mix of reviews however the good out-weighed the bad. Mind you I'm not a huge fan of sushi but everyone in a while I like to have some.

Now on to the good part..... the food!
My friend and I got the Deep fried spicy tuna roll= my favorite of the night! not too spicy either
Miso soup = pretty good not too salty
California hand roll= interesting concept think of it like an ice cream come but with sushi in it? and the "cone" is wrapped in seaweed. It was good your basic California roll 
Spicy scallop roll= good not great  

Overall the service was good and so was the food. I definitely would come back again and its a bonus that they're open late!
author: Eva B.

description:
First off, I love that this place is open late. Perfect for after a baseball game or NBA game! 

Second, this place has GREAT sashimi. It's super fresh, not chewy (which I've had bad experiences with other places before), and just tastes really good! I've had their chirashi bowl once and it was so delicious. The fish is very fresh and the rice they serve with it complements the fish very well, it's like sushi rice. 

I also love their bento boxes. It comes with a good amount of food. The tempura is really delicious, especially the vegetable tempura. The chicken is slightly crispy, and the teriyaki sauce is not overwhelming, which is good. 

My boyfriend and I always go here if we need a late dinner, because it's the only place open that sells good Japanese food. Parking is not too bad, all street parking. Service is good, I've never had issues with the service here.
author: Nikki P.

description:
Time for another 3.5 star grab bag! You never know what you'll get with 3.5ers, and it seems like the complaints for Sushiraw are a pretty good mix of slow service, sushi quality, and cleanliness. I'd say in terms of quality, don't come here if you're looking for a fancy, expensive sushi experience. Come here if you're just craving sushi or you're hungry. So keep that in mind.

I personally loved Sushiraw. I came here with my SO after a long day at work, on a cold, misty night. It was quiet and laid-back, and the server seemed friendly enough. 

We ordered the sashimi combo, the chicken udon, the devil mountain roll, and the shrimp tempura roll. The sashimi combo was alright and I loved the chicken udon. The broth was flavorful and the chicken was tender, although I did wish there was another fish cake (there was only one). We loved the devil mountain and the shrimp tempura rolls! They were super tasty. Also, the presentation is pretty cool--the sashimi plate came on a light up tray! And the other rolls we ordered were pretty neatly arranged.

I'd say the only downsides were that the sashimi combo wasn't the freshest, and I did think the chicken udon was a little heavy on the vegetables and could've used more chicken and fish cake.

Overall though, this place is pretty good for being a sushi place in the sunset at these prices. Some people come in expecting Jiro Dreams of Sushi, and this just isn't that kind of place. So, you get what you pay for and if you want the best sushi in the world, of course you're going to be disappointed.
author: Claire C.

description:
I usually order takeout here. Staff is nice and welcoming. They always offer water/tea while I'm waiting. I usually get the spicy salmon roll (no deep fried) which is pretty awesome. Udon and ramen are decent. I love the whole grilled squid, too!!
Great spot for late night snack!
author: Krystal P.

description:
Have you ever passed by a place so often that you kind of forget about them?  More than a little nonsensical to say, but pretty true for me and SushiRaw.  It's nothing against them; they just happened to blur into the background as I would pass by every day on my way to my old job.  As we aimlessly drove around in search of a late dinner though?  They sure did stand out, especially since we had a hankering for some sushi!

Stepping inside, the first thing that struck me was how much nicer this location was compared to their old spot in San Bruno.  Granted, it was a low bar to clear (the other one still reminded me of the Taco Bell that used to be there), but I like the dark decor and tinted windows.  More importantly though, the menu here looks a whole lot better.  Not only does it cover a wider range (sushi, sashimi, bento boxes, starters, udon, etc.), but it seems like there are more choices than I remember the other location have, especially with their rolls.

-- FUJI MOUNTAIN ROLL - Lobster Salad, Avocado, Mango Baked with Crab Meat, Scallop Spicy Sauce, and Tobiko...$16.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushiraw-san-francisco-6?select=bQtXHd_UXDk7bChNeo7Mgw)
It may not have added to the dish, but it was pretty cool to see them set the dish on fire.  In any case, this was pretty solid.  Despite not being able to taste the mango, I liked the mix of flavors from the lobster salad, avocado, and crab meat.

-- ROMEO & JULIET ROLL - Salmon and Avocado topped with Fresh Scallops, Tobiko, and Mayo and wrapped with a Soy Paper Wrap...$13.95
-- HOTATEGAI - Scallop Nigiri...$6.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushiraw-san-francisco-6?select=r9GyFlqPoEtvyGmVyFmR_Q)
I was looking for a roll that was relatively light and the Romeo & Juliet did the trick!  Both the scallops and salmon were really fresh and there wasn't a ton of sauce.  As for the Hotategai, I didn't plan on more scallops, but I'm glad I did.  Not only was the cut pretty large, but it was really tasty!

-- HAMACHI NIGIRI...$6.25
-- ROMEO & JULIET ROLL...$13.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushiraw-san-francisco-6?select=M_A-TTfdTtJoLH8DVkfMuw)
Having already tried their hotate and sake sashimi/nigiri, I only had the hamachi left to try.  All in all...not bad.  The cut was both generous and fresh, but this wasn't the most flavorful one I've had.  As for the Romeo & Juliet roll, it was just about as good as the first time around.

-- SESAME CHICKEN - Deep Fried Chicken Japanese Style with Spicy Sauce...$6.50
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushiraw-san-francisco-6?select=Enps7aCSuLliCEoaNXkycA)
Honestly, this just wasn't very good.  Not only did every piece have more batter than chicken, but they weren't all that flavorful either.  Had I known the "sesame" was just a ton of seeds dumped into the aioli, I wouldn't have bothered with this.

-- SAKE SASHIMI...$11.95 (or $6 if you order $25 or more)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushiraw-san-francisco-6?select=ADVTNp_0JpMII-8M1P_JlQ)
While they may not have been the prettiest of slices (a little uneven and a couple looked a little "torn"), this certainly tasted the part!  As with the scallops and the hamachi, the salmon was both fresh and tasty.

Considering all of the restaurants that have passed through this space in the years since the old ZIm's closed, it's great how SushiRaw has found continued success over the years.  Whether it's day or not, it seems like there are always at least a handful of folks grabbing a bite here whenever I pass by.  What's more, it seems like they do a steady amount of to-go business as well, as I saw a ton of people stop in to pick up orders.

All in all, despite some of the things I tried not amazing, SushiRaw isn't too shabby.  The food is decent, prices are fair, service is fine, parking isn't hard, seating isn't tough, and they're one of the few Japanese joints around that's open late (until midnight).  It may not be the type of place you make a point of going to, but they sure are handy to have around!
author: Mike L.

description:
I used to frequent their excelsior location on mission street very often when I lived in the area, but since I moved they shut down and this is the closest Raw to me. I had only been to this location one time before and enjoyed it but with so many other options wasn't compelled to come back. In the last 5 years they've remodeled their inside and definitely upped their game because this place is solid. 

All the nigiri i had was incredibly fresh, highlighted t the always stunning sake belly. The fish was perfectly presented and lush in color with a great ratio of plump meat to soft rice. 

Both rolls I tried were also knockouts. The City Roll was a complex play on texture with crispy soft shell crab, succulent yellow tail, and fatty avocado. It towed the line between over the top American and more traditional in a way that really spoke to me. 

The Mexican Desert Roll was more rich and absolutely awesome. Perfectly presented with little slides of jalapeño and dabs of hot sauce atop squishy imitation crab and seared smoky albacore. It legit tasted like sushi nachos and I would order it again in a second. 

Service was great and they even brought out a big bowl of mango ice cream for my brothers birthday. Highly recommend and will return when in the area!
author: Sean S.

description: Just moved here and I'm looking for a great sushi restaurant. And I finally found one, top to bottom best sushi experience I've ever had
author: Abdallah A.

description:
Date night.

Sushi? Why not! 

Usually Ozumo is my choice for date night. For everyday sushi you can find me at Amami sushi.

I decided to pick somewhere different. Somewhat familiar but different. I'm glad I did! 

We had 

Hirame Carpaccio

Japanese Uni

Fuji Mountain Roll (If you like the theatrics of flambé get this)

Chefs choice sashimi 

Unagi sushi 

Amaebi - they fried the heads for us to enjoy after we finished the sweet raw shrimps

Sapporo 

Sake 

Service was excellent, the sushi was impossibly fresh, and the sake was delicious. 

No fuss date night perfection in the Sunset. Glad I said yes to that! 

Five stars for perfection.

**then we slipped out to the dive bar next door to drink whiskey before the "date date" part of the night
author: Jennifer C P.

description: We after-partied here on a whim.  We had just stuffed ourselves to the gills on Octoberfest food- brats, pulled pork, hard boiled eggs (not sure that's German...) potato salad, did I forget to mention that OMG pulled pork? So really we were not looking for more food just wanted to car pool some peops home...  We were at the right light when someone said hey there's a sushi place there? Sooo....  And hey there's always room for sushi, right? We ordered rolls only.  My favorites were Cherry Blossom, Romeo and Juliet and 49'er.  Everything was delicious. The service was very attentive.  We will definitely keep this place on our list.
author: Keeping It Real K.

description:
My friend found a black hair in her miso soup and it was kindof a weird experience thereafter. She went to go tell the waitress and the waitress kept insisting to bring her a new one. She even came back to the table and asked again, after my friend told her many times that she was not interested. I'm assuming they make the miso in a large pot, so if there was a hair in one soup, it was from that main pot of miso...

Ordered some regular rolls: Crunchy and Rock n Roll. 
Nothing special, you could buy same quality from Safeway.
author: Olivia L.

description:
Save your money - find another place
Food orders sent incorrect and when they called Reevy came back an hour and a half later.
author: A. Marie L.

description: Fish was flavorless and mushy. Lacks any real flavor in the sushi. Plus the wait time is insane. Took twice as long as other sushi restaurants to get our food. High noise level in establishment. Try another place.
author: Brad R.

description:
Despite the fact that it is ON 19th and has huge windows out onto 19th, it's not actually loud in there.  

Relatively small place, had to wait a few minutes to get a seat at the bar at 8pm, on Saturday, but they do take reservations, so that could be avoided.

It's actually pretty fun to sit at the bar because you see the sushi guys doing their thing and it's impressive how fast they move and how hard they work!

My favorite of the night was the vegetarian roll with mango, cucumber, avo, and seaweed salad on top.  The mango was a good addition and the seaweed salad was really crunchy and delicious.  The Shrimp Tempura and Chicken Teriyaki Roll were both also quite good. I like the Swamp Roll the least - I think because it only had the sweet potato in it and just wasn't complex enough.

If you purchase $20 off the menu then they have a special menu which you can order something else off of for cheaper which is cool (a small beer for example is only $2).

It looked like they had some really fun specials too - like a LIVE urchin, and other sashimi platters served on ice with lights (advantage of sitting at the bar - sight seeing). 

The way they managed the making of sushi was interesting. They made some of ours and then they paused, made other peoples, and then made more of ours. Not a bad model - maybe this is what everyone does, but noticed it here particularly.
author: Sarah C.

description:
We love this place .  Fresh and fast serving !!!! Best delivery . Everyone are super friendly and hey already know what we like and  what we may forgot to order !!! 

Fish is so fresh , and juicy .
author: Tetyana G.

description:
Tl;dr Parking was kinda rough, but the food was good.

Sushi Raw wasent busy when we arrived and immediately got sat. Our server was nice and quick to take our order. We did have to remind her that we ordered tea but that was no big deal.

We ordered the 3 item bento box (Tonkatsu, Short Ribs, and mixed Tempura), Philly Roll, and Seaweed Salad. The bento box was good. The tempura and Tonkatsu were nice and crispy, not burnt. The short ribs were tender and not drenched in sauce. The philly roll had a good ratio of cream cheese to salmon. Seaweed salad was good as well.

Bathroom is very narrow though so some people might have to squeeze.
author: Andrew L.

description: Surprise surprise - some of the best sushi and customer service we have ever had. Delicious, fresh (they fly it in daily) and offer several gluten free options. My son is allergic to seafood and they made sure he was safe. (Yes, I realize we are in a sushi place with seafood allergies, but he loves he other fish!)
author: B C.

description:
This review is just for delivery. 

Officially--best delivery for sushi in the neighborhood! Fish is fresh, and the orders are consistent. I'm happy with their bentos as well. 

They deliver quickly, and I appreciate that they're open late. 

I only wish they had more variety in rolls with solely raw fish, as in their name. 

From people calling me about my order, and the delivery guy, service has been great. Thank you for making my evenings easier after a long day!
author: jolie L.

description: I love it all the food. I asked for delivery and was really tasty, was very fast. It was the fast delivered I have had :)
author: Nayara B.

description:
We ordered delivery at 10:45 p.m. after a long day of traveling. The food arrived on the early end of the 45-60 minute delivery window (thank goodness) and everything was fresh and tasty. We ordered tempura udon with clear broth, gyoza, and the sushi raw veggie roll. 

Udon: The broth was light and not too salty. My husband doctored it up with some of the tempura dipping sauce, but I thought it was tasty as served. Nice ratio of noodles to broth. The tempura was a little soggy (not to self: delivery tempura, not the best idea), but the vegetables were perfectly tender and everything tasted good.

Gyoza: Yum! Well seasoned and well cooked.

Sushi raw veggie roll: This was like a swamp roll without the meat. I loved the combination of seaweed salad and sweet mango. It was a little hard to eat because each piece was on the large side, but I was willing to cope. I would definitely order this roll again.

Overall, we were very happy with Sushiraw and grateful that we had it as a late night delivery option!
author: Ali S.

description: For years now I wanted to stop at the sushi bar on my way to SFO and back. Tonight was that night and I am so glad we did. Our server named Quinn was a delight and an excellent waitress. She made several suggestions that were phenomenal. Waitresses like her get well over 20% in a well deserved tip. Our food was delicious. I encourage everyone to check this place out.
author: Rachele K.

description: The quality of the sushi is just okay. They are Chinese establishment. Do yourself a favor and go to Japan Town for good sushi. They charge for extra ginger that supposed to come with each roll. They don't care for business and don't do catering. If you plan on driving, there is no street parking
author: Vlad V.

description:
This is the best sushi I've had delivered. Haven't had anything else delivered, though.
We ordered enough to get a free roll. So they gave us a duplicate of the eel roll we ordered, instead of the other option.
Both were good, but redundant, and certainly, variety would have been appreciated.
The ikura sushi should be called rice with some orange eggs. Some is the operative word. One layer that did not even cover the rice.
Weak.
The sunomono was cucumber pickle, sure, there were 2 slices of fish, just as this as the cucumber slices, but, nearly invisible.
The rest of it 50 dollar order was unremarkable.
But, they did deliver.
author: Hal S.

description: If you're looking for bang for your buck, sushiraw is the place. Very good (not amazing) sushi for a great deal. Hot sake is good too!
author: Lillian W.

description: This place was actually amazing. The place my boyfriend and I usually go to is closed on mondays and I don't usually like new things but we tried this place and I don't regret it. Service was fast, everyone was super nice, and the food was terrific. Would definitely come back.
author: Oshion J.

description:
Sushi raw .
What can you say , once you have found parking.  We came on a Friday night around 6:45 we found the place not crowded. I figure that  this is because of parking. 
We ordered the sushi deluxe meal. My wife wanted to order the lobster roll, the
Waitress with purple hair suggested to order the whole lobster for a couple of dollars more, so I said why not , wow the wow factor was worth it. It taste was good not knock your socks off , but still worth the money. 
The sushi deluxe version, came with lots of food and California rolls. Soup and salad. Nothing special, but worth the price for what you get. 
We also ordered an appetizer of grilled
Squid. This item takes time to cook right so it came after we had our main dishes, no big deal because I know it take a while to cook. 
Also they have a special menu if you order something like $30 off the regular menu you can order one item from the special menu at a reduced price.  So I got a small sake. For a dollar . 
I was so stuffed, we had a Togo container. 
We where also given a nut cracker for the lobster claws, it was funny when the waitress came up to me an said to be careful with them, I guess some
People don't know how to crack lobster. But it was cute. 
For the money it was well worth the money.
Not authentic but decently price for what you get.
author: Jesse S.

description:
Open late with quality nigiri.
Perfect after a late night workout or airport pickup. Ramen is good and the sushi is definitely worth the trip.  $16 for 8 pieces is a great deal in this city and the quality and freshness of the fish is spot on.  Also there is a $1 menu if your order is $15 or more which gives you the choice of sushi, oysters, or beer/sake for one dollar.  Come on man!  Better than the $1 menu at McDonald's!!!!
JYW recommends!
author: Jeff W.

description: Fastest delivery I have ever had. Food was great, rainbow roll was just what I needed.
author: Myk V.

description: Great place if you're looking for a bite to eat pass 9p. First time in Cali so this was our first meal. Their entrees can be made into an ala cart or bento which includes rice and miso soup. Their beer is a great price and this place is worth it!
author: Kristal Z.

description:
The quality isn't the best, but the location is convenient for sushi. The service isn't super consistent either - sometimes one will be very attentive and another will disappear for like 10 minutes when you're trying to get some help. Last time I went, we ordered the sea bass appetizer and it wasn't until I flagged someone down for help because we didn't receive it yet and we were all done eating basically...wasn't it listed as an appetizer?

I do think one of the nice things offered is when you spend at least $15, you get a discount on a few items (good for groups) - $1 small sake or beer / $2 for large, $5 5 pc sashimi, etc.
author: Cheri C.

description: So for a long time I've been craving a lobster roll and I finally got one while going here. I expected what anyone else would have expected a sushi roll to look like. However, this lobster roll replaced the rice and seaweed wrap with a cucumber wrap. I was mind blown. At first I saw it and was disappointed because it seemed so small for $14-$15. Then I tasted it and it was amazing! One of the best rolls I've had. Wish I had more but it was definitely worth getting.
author: Isaac H.

description:
Yep, still like this place. 
I love ordering for pick-up on Eat24. Instructions were followed wonderfully. If you are ordering for a vegetarian make sure to ask that they put those rolls together, or else they might put a vegetarian roll next to a meat roll. 
Swamp Roll is my husband's favorite, and if you like seaweed salad it might be your new favorite too. Sushi Raw doesn't skimp on the fancy vegetarian rolls. They even have a rice less roll for the low carbers. 
I wouldn't call Sushi Raw the finest sushi establishment, but they are still a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Heather F.

description: Food was delicious but it took WAY TOO LONG TO COME OUT. For a rice plate had to wait 40 min and now one is even here.. they need to work on deliver and making the food faster and the portion is a bit small and over priced. The dishes are super dirty, especially the cups I always drink out of a straw and I'm glad I did because their glasses still have residue like they haven't washed it, and I can feel the residue and it's gross. But they were nice and friendly and good service besides food taking way too long.
author: Melanie P.

description: I'd consider myself a regular here.  It's consistently good and filling.  Not knock-your-socks-off good, but so far the best Japanese I've found on this part of the Taraval corridor.  Might suffer a bit from the loud road noise being right on the corner of 19th Ave, but the bonus discount price menu is a good incentive to dine-in.  Wait staff are all very friendly.
author: Greg C.

description:
Overpriced for the quality you get. I was not impressed with anything I ordered. The only thing that hit the spot was the complimentary green tea cause it was cold and raining outside. 

It really annoys me when a sushi bar cuts your roll so thick that it becomes difficult to fit the entire thing in your mouth and successfully chew. Alternative is to bite the thing in half and then have the roll fall apart. That's how my philly roll came and it was annoying. I also ordered the cherry blossom and didn't care for it. I definitely would not order that again even though it looks good in the menu picture. Added the $5 albacore sashimi for the $15 purchase and that was probably best part of the meal. 

Definitely an option for late night eats in this part of town, but you could do better.
author: Taryn S.

description:
Rating: 3.5 stars

I must say I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of sushi at Sushi Raw. This place has been on the corner of Taraval and 19th for as long as I can remember. With so many other sushi options around, I never thought to try out Sushi Raw. The other night the bf wanted a lighter meal for dinner, so he suggested Sushi Raw. Apparently he'd gone with a friend not too long ago, and it wasn't bad in terms of price and quality. 

We came by on a Friday night around...9? It was late and way past a typical dinner time, but the place was pretty busy. We got seated at the bar right away and served up menus and tea. They have like 3 menus, and they're quite extensive. Nigiri, rolls, appetizers, udon (I think), donburi and some other Japanese dishes. 

We ordered some nigiri (hamachi belly, hotate, tai and maguro) and two rolls (I don't remember exactly which two, but I think one was the tuna lover's). We also ordered 2 eel hand rolls and 1 spicy tuna hand roll from their special "if you spend over $30, you get these items for $1-2" menu (dine-in only). Our total was somewhere in the $45 range, which isn't bad for sushi.

The nigiri wasn't half bad! They give you pretty big slices of fish and the rice is passable. They do put some sauces on the nigiri and also put wasabi IN the nigiri, so that's another nice surprise. The quality of fish for the nigiri is decent for what you're paying, though I feel like the pieces of fish are a bit too big. That's just my preference -- It kind of makes me want to gag when it's just a huge piece of raw fish (especially if it's not the fresher fish out there). Rolls and nigiri came out quickly and presented nicely (I'm sorry for the overuse of "nice"). 

Overall service wasn't bad, though we never got our tea refilled (even after asking) and it took forever to wave down someone to get us the check =/

Decent nigiri and good selection of rolls makes Sushi Raw a viable option for sushi. It wouldn't be my first choice, but at least it's on my radar now.
author: Doris K.

description: After Mission closed this is my go to place. Got a bento last Saturday I will definitely come back for my order to go :)
author: Erika E.

description:
My to go to when I'm craving sushi!
It's good and never have to wait so long when ordering food.
author: Tania M.

description: One of our go-to places in the neighborhood. Sushi rolls are good and dinners too. Good portions and delivery is timely. Thumbs up!
author: Susan W.

description: Our choices came down to 3 Japanese restaurants for delivery.  Sushiraw is a place we had never tried so we gave it a go.  The prices were average to high, but through the Yelp reviews, I gathered that they had a reputation for good taste and quality.  We ordered a variety of 8 sushi rolls, ranging from the lower priced California Roll to the pricier Dragon Roll and an order of Chicken Udon.  For a Tuesday evening, delivery was fairly quick (35-40 mins).  The sushi looked great and tasted very fresh.  It wasn't soggy or overly sauced, the rolls that had a crunchy element, such as the Salmon Skin Roll, were actually crunchy.  The only average item seemed to be the udon.  There was nothing special about it.  If you want really good sushi for delivery, I would highly recommend Sushiraw.  We will definitely be ordering from them again.
author: Mel P.

description: Aw shit, I just discovered this place around the corner from my house that's open late and has a pretty sizable vegetarian/vegan roll selection. They also deliver if you're nearby so call them instead of using Uber Eats or Postmates or whatever!
author: Danica N.

description: Service is the worst. Can't speak to the food bc it hasn't come yet. My husband has finished his meal already (bento box) while I'm still waiting for my roll (not even a baked roll).
author: Jessica C.

description:
I have been ordering take-out from this place once a week for the past month since I live just around the corner and always feel sushi is a suitable + healthy dinner when I don't feel like cooking (every Monday basically).

Last night, I ate here in-house for the first time. Mainly because the place is a Poke-Gym and I was really down to battle while I waited for my food, but also because I didn't feel like I could accurately review this place unless I actually sat in the establishment and experienced all it's glory. 

The food is good. Standard sushi for a standard price with delicious miso to match. I ordered the Taraval Street Roll ($9.25), which I think is delicious with tempura, mango and cilantro all working your tastebuds in perfect harmony. I also have tried the Philly Roll (standard) and the Dragon Roll (good, but not fantastic for $12.25). The food gets a thumbs up.

However, the service was less-than-to-be-desired. Our waitress was brusque and all my food arrived about 10 minutes later than my friend's. I was hungry and even pokemon couldn't distract me from the long, unnecessary wait.

Needless to say, next time I will skip the dine-in experience and looking presentable, and just order take-out again where I can stay home and watch Netflix in peace.
author: Anna P.

description:
I use to love this place when Simon was the Owner .. since he sold the place it went down the hill . Rolls are huge and have tooo much rice . Selection of fish is simple and not what it use to be
Service also not the best at this point . Today was my last day eat there
author: Al S.

description: The prices are just okay but the food is nice. My friend really like the veggie rolls they had, while I enjoyed the larger portion of chicken and rice teriyaki. I will definitely come back to his place again, but there's other Asian food places on Taraval that I'll choose first.
author: Davey S.

description:
This is one of the best in town. Got some really cool combo discount deals. And the fish is really fresh. The sushi is good. The rolls are great. And it's relatively cheap. 

Great meal with nice ambience. Also the service is on point. Never saw the bottom of my tea cup. 

Did I mention how good the food is.
author: Jesse J.

description: Use to be my go to for my Japanese need..use to live close by and come here for dinner, the owner here is real helpful and give real good recommendations of what to get. I normally get the bento box, and I love everything on the menu. Sushi roll is good...my favorite is the Godzilla roll and the dragon roll.
author: Calvin T.

description: Great goma ae (spinach salad) and veggie rolls. Wish their Tempura batter n miso soup were vegan friendly. Overall good service, comfy setting, but kinda pricey.
author: Nova J.

description: This is my favorite Japanese restaurant in San Francisco and I love that they have so many delicious vegetarians options. The place is nice and the service is amazing!
author: Priscila C.

description: This is definitely our go to spot. I'm from the neighborhood I stopped looking for other Japanese food delivery once I found this place years ago. They always deliver my order accurately and on time or early with few exceptions over the years and I can count on the quality. I like the ambiance of the restaurant and one of these days we'll actually go sit and eat there, but the speedy delivery makes it a no brainer. My favorite is the Taraval Street roll and Jalapeño roll. I also really like that they offer free items if you spend so much. It's hard to find a place that values its customers in such a way.
author: Sarah A.

description: I love this place I really do !! The hours suck I went in 3 mins before they closed to eat and they said sorry we are closed why are your door open?? Sad to give this place these stars but that was not okay.
author: Karina C.

description:
Came here in the afternoon last Sunday (7/20) and the place was empty! There was literally only one table who arrived just before us and then later two more parties joined. 

My friends decided to eat here because apparently one of them never had sushi before! We didn't know where else to go that was close by and I'm not too familiar with the restaurants in the area so we just ducked into the first sushi place we saw. 

We ordered simple rolls - spicy tuna, a cali roll, a rock 'n roll, and a negi hama maki. They were very basic, not bad but not in any way extraordinary. At least the cali rolls were kinda big. 

Because we had an older over $15, we added an unagi hand roll for $1 (special deal). 

There were two waitresses working. Hard to tell them apart, but whoever was going to our table always had a displeased look on their face. 

Sushi Raw might have potential, but that will need another visit before I can give them a higher rating.
author: Adrienne L.

description:
We've been ordering takeout from here for years, but after a decline in the food and timeliness over the past year or so I think tonight was the last chance.. 

The last order we made a couple weeks ago they hadn't updated their online ordering and so we got our bento boxes and the order was missing the "free" California roll as well as the sushi my receipt said each bento box came with, which has been the case for years. I guess they changed their menu without notifying the online ordering place, which we found out after we got the food. I would've been less irritated if they had remembered our "free" roll and hadn't taken over an hour to deliver the food. 

This time we decided to try them one more time and we ordered rolls instead of the bento box we used to get that no longer comes with sushi. The food was alright, the order took over an hour and fifteen minutes to get here. Our one hot item was cold. I always pre-tip 20-25% too!

So after about a year of second chances I think we have to say bye to sushi raw and try someone new. Two stars instead of one because the sushi is ok.
author: Christina W.

description: Came here after work for a bite to eat and the ambiance of it was delightful. What a way to relax with fresh sashimi n sake being placed right in front with you.
author: Mikayla R.

description: My go to sushi in the sunset district. Casual ambiance, good sushi, pretty cheap. Four seasons roll is as delicious as it looks!
author: Raisa G.

description:
First off, this place is conveniently open late until midnight, which is great because a lot of restaurants close early in the city.

A pretty decent place to grab a late dinner. I usually go for their ramen- house special, beef, or tonkatsu are all pretty good- ranging from $9-$11. Not bad at all. I have yet to try their sushi though.

As for their service, they're really nice. They check up on you and ask how the food is, and they consistently refill your waters(which I love because I need lots of water while I eat). 

I love the ambiance here as well, somewhat of a dark setting and really clean and modern looking. Never too loud here either.

Good tasting food, reasonably priced, and great service!
author: Janica V.

description:
Satisfying a late-night sushi craving is not an easy feat. At Sushi Raw? A doable task. They're open until midnight on weekdays, which is pretty darn late for a sushi place! 

Pleasant decor with dark wooden tables, hanging lantern style lights, and a mixture of booth, table, and sushi bar seating. The windows are tinted to help shield you from the bright car lights on 19th Ave. and maintain the dim lighting and warm ambiance of the restaurant. 

All the rolls are very Americanized, on the larger side, and heavy on the rice. The fish didn't taste super fresh and I felt like the quality wasn't there. No clean and distinct flavors stood out to me. I found the Lion King Roll particularly disappointing because it didn't taste fully baked through or creamy like most other places. It only had cooked salmon on top. 

Our server wasn't pushy about getting us out of the restaurant even though we were there 15 mins past closing, but she wasn't exactly attentive with refilling our waters or punctual about asking if we wanted the check later either. 

Prices are pretty good and the rolls aren't bad, but if you're looking for authentic, fresh tasting sushi, this is not it. I personally don't mind paying more for higher quality sushi and won't be back here unless nothing else is open. Not a bad experience, but nothing was memorable.
author: Deanna Y.

description: Honestly, I'm really impressed with this place. Affordable and some of the best sushi I've ever eaten. The sashimi is super great quality and thick pieces.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I used to only order take-out from here, and felt it was as good as any, and definitely reliable.  Only recently I started to go and dine-in.  Totally worth going inside!!  The service is a little spotty-- they are SUPER NICE-- but they will leave you alone at your table for over 10 min. at a time-- that said-- whenever flagged, they are quick to come ask!  
I order something not on the menu.. but was suggested while dining-- it's called PokeMon salad ( a combo of poke and delicious crispy things)-- so fresh and delicious.
The 49ers roll, and Fuji Mtn. Lion King roll (something like that!) -- it comes table side with a flame beneath!  So cool.. 
Oh-- only reason it's not 5 stars?  LOUD PLACE!!!!  get ready to NOT HEAR the person sitting across from you-- romance??  Not so much-- but GREAT SUSHI?? Yes!
author: Kelly C.

description: While the service was great, the food was just average and definitely forgettable. The only thing I really recommend is the salmon kama. I probably won't be coming back.
author: Tran N.

description:
This is currently my go to sushi place in the city. Prices are decent, but they offer a cheaper menu with every $15 dollar you spend (ex. $5 for 5 thick slices of salmon). I personally don't like the rolls as much and I would stay away from the lion king. It's not baked in an oven and doesn't even come out in foil so it doesn't taste the same as the other places I'm used to. The raw oysters are also always super tiny; on my recent trip I got one that was a size of a quarter. 
I do recommend ordering the sashimi and nigiri, they offer generous cuts and they're always fresh. Uni nigiri is priced at $8, unfortunately they don't pile on the uni, but it's enough to satisfy my cravings. 

Although the place is fairly small, there's usually barely any wait for two people even during the prime dinner time at 7pm. The servers are pretty attentive and the place kept clean. Definitely recommend trying this place!
author: Renee Y.

description: This place is not as good as I expected. Was better when I had it years ago, I think it was a different name then maybe... I wanted to try them again so I decided to get some delivery one night. Anyway, I enjoyed the cooked rolls fine but I was not impressed with the raw fish sushi rolls that I ordered. I got a hamachi roll that was darker colored and fishy tasting. Also in the Philadelphia roll, the smoked salmon was pretty nasty (and I love lox). Also the walu on another roll that I had was not terribly fishy but not great, kind of mushy, no firmness to it. I ended up throwing these away. So ya, good cooked sushi but in the end of the day, you gotta have really quality raw fish to be a good sushi restaurant. Unfortunately, I didn't get that on the night I ordered delivery.
author: David S.

description:
I love how they give free food when you've spent a certain amount on top of free deliveries!

I also love the deals they give you when you get sushi, which they design creatively. It's a great sushi place with great deals. One of my all time favorites!
author: Nichole L.

description:
My cousin and I got there a little bit before 10 and there was a decent amount of parking around restaurant. The service was nice, our server was easy to talk to and made sure we're okay. We got 4 different rolls, the niagara roll, lobster roll, deep fried California roll, and shrimp tempura roll. It did not taste bad, it was actually good. We really liked the lobster roll especially. We also got the beef tongue which was also good but we thought it was too over priced for one skewer, although we still ordered it because we were craving it. 

I like how they're open late for those who are looking for a place to dine in. The workers were nice and very creative when it comes time to plating their sushi, mostly the special sushi's. I wouldn't mind coming back with some friends to enjoy their food.
author: Ina S.

description: This is my favorite sushi place. I always get the hot summer roll or the four seasons roll. Both are very good. Also the garlic edamame is delicious. The wait staff are very nice and the wait is not often long (for food or for a table).
author: Emily S.

description: this place has a nice ambiance to it and the food comes out pretty fast. i enjoyed eating here but the only thing is their ramen was suuuper salty. i had to add a bunch of water secretly.
author: Carla E.

description:
My friend and i came here after work around 10pm on a week night. It wasn't busy at all. We ordered the four seasons roll, philly roll, and fresh oysters. the fresh oysters were madddd tiny! i don't think they're worth the price, $2 each. but they were good i guess. My favorite was the four seasons roll. it was delicious! 

one thing i would like to note though is that you can only order ONE item off of the special dine in menu, which you can order off of when you spend $15 or more. to order a second item your bill must be over $30. I didn't know that, so i wish they would have put that on that menu. 

overall i would come back. sashimi and rolls are very good and very reasonably priced.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I've been wanting to come to this place for awhile now since I pass by it from time to time, and I also thought this place was 24hrs but it's actually open until midnight. 

From the street view, the outside makes the restaurant look like it's going to be big, but it's actually a bit small on the inside, spacious, but small. The interior is all black with spots of wood, which was nice because it gives an intimate feel. I really liked the soy sauce container that they had because it wasn't something tacky like another kikkoman glass and also the little dish that held the soy sauce was cute (it's all about the details, loved!) 

We ordered their large sake and a large sapporo so we can do sake bombs, wasn't a big fan of the shot glasses that they provided but we worked with it anyways. We also ordered their 49er roll, lion king roll, rock n' roll,plum roll and their chicken teriyaki roll. 
Lion king roll & rock n' roll: always good. 
Plum roll: presentation was pretty and tasted delicious. 
Chicken teriyaki roll: the chicken itself was flavorful, not dry, and crispy from the skin: delicious! 
Prices for their sushi are typical, $5-14(?) of course their special rolls are $10+ but I think they were worth it.

Service: nice, speedy and filled our waters constantly which is a BIG plus for me. 

I will definitely be coming back here. :)
author: Grace Anne D.

description: Teriyaki chicken was gross don't get it. More like slimy chicken skin with teriyaki barley glazed on it for $7!
author: Julia P.

description:
** PLEASE NOTE  --  this is a review of the customer service we experienced.

I have never experienced such terrible and disrespectful attitude coming from a wait staff in my life, and I do not mean this to be an exaggeration.

My family and I had not dined here in over a year and we have always had a positive experience (read my 4 previous reviews). Upon arrival, our normal waitress who had always been there was not present; and the chefs we knew who worked behind the sushi bar were also missing. That's alright, restaurants have high turnover rates.

At some point during the meal, my father asked the waiter whether there is any yakisoba type noodle dish on the menu. We've been coming here on-and-off for 2 years and I knew the answer to that question was more than likely going to be no; but hey, there is no harm in asking right? What if the menu was changed? The waiter rolled his eyes, said a curt "no", and walked away. I thought that was going to be the end of it. My glance followed the waiter and this is what I witnessed next. He walked over to the other waitress on the floor, shot a sideway glance towards my father, scoffed, and said in Cantonese: "what an ignorant man" at a volume loud enough for me - which means also for my father, mother, Boyfriend, and the next table - to hear.

I have scoffed and mocked people n my life so I am not trying to come off as holier-than-thou. However, I have never ever done it in public and I definitely have never done it while I was working or in a professional environment. And regardless, my father did nothing to deserve this blatant display of disrespect; he asked a very simple question that any Joe Schmoe could just as easily have asked in that situation. So let me ask, mr. waiter, what about my father's question irritated you so much so that you had to react this way? And mr. waiter, even though I don't work in the food industry, let me offer you a piece of advice, the next time you feel the need to disrespect a person who pays your salary and your tip (20% in this case), don't.
author: Karen S.

description:
Funnily, we went here unintentionally. After the 2013 Color Run, our party of 5 was craving something light for lunch (or so we thought). We had planned on dining at Sushi Zen, but our hunger got the best of us--the more convenient, eye-catching Sushi Raw got our business.

Despite the affordable lunch specials, we decided to go family style with 4 rolls and some Big Discount items (described below).

We first chose the ISLAND ROLL with tuna, salmon, and yellow tail wrapped with cucumber, 6 pieces for $12.99 (http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/VoBBC_Z9yH2uIaZQhzsexQ/l.jpg). The combination was refreshing, although the cucumber was not that crisp and the fish were not markedly fresh. Since this is a light roll, eat this first because its flavor can be easily overpowered!

Next was the FOUR SEASONS ROLL with eel, imitation crab, and avocado topped with tuna and avocado, 8 pieces for $12.99 (http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/d71TaWul4vjL-oIbw2uc3w/l.jpg). This was my favorite by far...EXCEPT FOR THE WASABI SAUCE. AUGH. They drizzle it on top with the other sauces, but because I have an aversion to wasabi, it totally killed my palate :(

Third was the TARAVAL STREET ROLL with eel, shrimp tempura, imitation crab meat, cilantro, and mango, topped with tobiko, 6 pieces for $8.99 (http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5fGG2OQ6tgVzHbvU6WNoiQ/l.jpg). This is a good, reliable roll, though the mango is not very noticeable. Gotta love that shrimp tempura though!

Last was the HOT SUMMER ROLL with spicy tuna topped with crab meat, salmon, and baked with spicy sauce and tobiko, 8 pieces for $12.99 (http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/chB1j_Q8rzFnGwu7a_iVxA/l.jpg). The stringy red things on top were very interesting texture-wise, but the crab meat and spicy tuna overpowered the subtlety of the salmon.

For every $15 ordered off the regular menu, you get the option to choose an item off the Big Discount menu (borrowing Jessica C's picture: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-raw-san-francisco-3?select=GbuCLrQRKTIfUm9ue_ZgzQ#93Snh8xG0eUMkiLS4qRc9w). Since we had ordered over $45, we chose 3 items: UNAGI HAND ROLL for $1 (http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MzsP_bAr1K-0v-IZyN005g/l.jpg), SPICY TUNA HAND ROLL for $1 (http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/OEtkgaDNi7yYFJ8muZH78g/l.jpg), and SEAWEED SALAD for $2, normally $4.99. The spicy tuna was fantastic.

Our total bill was $52, which came out to $13 per person. After a morning of colorrific running that cost each of us $50, having a decent lunch at less than a third of that price was pretty good. The rolls aren't mind-blowing, but I would recommend the TARAVAL STREET ROLL, $8.99, and the FOUR SEASONS ROLL, $12.99, as long as you don't mind the overpowering wasabi sauce (or ask for it on the side).
author: Adele F.

description: Awesome sushi! Sashimi and rolls are well priced. Come here time to time with my family. Take out ready really fast and efficient.
author: Sherali Z.

description: The sushi and udon was OK, but I give this place a higher rating for being open until midnight on a Saturday night. That's hard to find in SF.
author: Flora B.

description:
Came in on a Tuesday night around 10pm,not crowded,but got full once we got seated. Sashimi was great,but it just took TOO long to get our food. 
Not a lot of sushi spots are open late,so this place was convenient for me.
Parking was easy since it was late, I would still come back here to get my sushi fix!
author: Samantha M.

description: This place rocks! The service is great, they are very attentive and nice. The food is awesome! The rolls are tasty and made to perfection and the ingredients taste fresh. Highly recommend this one!
author: Iara O.

description: We were coming here about once a week. Initially, we were impressed with the attentive and friendly service, tastiness of the entrees and the good value.  Unfortunately, the restaurant has gone downhill until the final straw when we felt they no longer valued our business and walked out of the restaurant (more about that later).  As stated, our initial experiences were very positive.  Portions were generous and the service was attentive and friendly.  However, we slowly noticed a deterioration of the service, friendliness and the food.  For example, when we ordered the tonkatsu bento, we would receive two cutlets.  But more recently, it has been reduced to a single cutlet.  Although probably  better for us in the long run, we felt that we were treated inconsistently.  The final straw was when we (party of 4) arrived around 6 pm on a Friday evening.  There were 3 people in the whole restaurant but they tried to seat us by the front door next to a table with a young baby.  I wanted to avoid the draft coming in the front door whenever people entered and didn't want to sit that close to a young baby and asked if we could sit at one of the open tables by the window.  The waitress said they could not do that because they would not be able to split the tables IF 2 groups of 2 came in.  There was no reservations, but they were planning for the possible contingency.  Ok, we are not ones to linger - we eat and run.  Yet, they would rather have us leave than to try to accommodate us.  No apology or anything.  This was surprising given that we have been visiting every week.  In view of their attitude, we will accommodate them and won't be back.
author: Will L.

description:
Stopped in late on a Sunday night around 10:30. The place was nearly empty. The boyfriend and I took our seats at the bar area. 

We were greeted immediately and offered warm tea, which we accepted happily on this chilly San Francisco night. But we were both disappointed that the "hot tea" was more like Lukewarm (and that's being generous..). It tasted great, but could have really used some heat.

Looking over the menu there are so many options, we settled on a special that came with California Sushi Roll, Sashimi, Miso and Salad. 

The Miso and Salad came to us very quickly. Soup was tastey but nothing unusual. The salad however was a little disappointing. The lettuce was either old or had been frozen, the leaves were basically translucent and limp. The dressing did taste good, peanut-y but the lettuce just ruined it for us.

California Roll was well put together, slightly over-sized, but smaller then others I've had. I prefer the smaller size as they fit better into the mouth.

Sashimi was fresh and beautiful, just as it should be. Cut wonderfully and laid over slightly sweet sticky rice it was a beautiful addition to the meal. All the fish had a soft texture, some event buttery. Each carried their own unique flavor and needed little to no soy sauce.

This is a nice little spot for late-night sushi and I would happily return.
author: Meghan L.

description: Yay for the food!  Boo at the service.  I don't know why it was so slow, but for some reason it was.  It wasn't crazy busy, but my food took longer compared to the rest of my party.  I had ordered sushi whereas most of the table had ordered ramen.  However, some still had rolls too.  Anyways, the service is pretty meh, but I really enjoyed the food.  They had a really good special that offered cheaper items for every $15 you spent as a party.  There were some great deals like $1 handrolls, $2 beers, or $5 sashimi.  I had the Double Hamachi maki as my main.  It was really good combining fried and seared hamachi.  Really nice combo.  My only complaint was how small the filling inside the roll was.  It was pretty much a pen-size in filling.  But the top still had some fish on it, and it was sure tasty.  The handrolls were pretty good too, I liked their spicy tuna hand roll, and the unagi was not bad too.  Overall, I wouldn't mind coming back, the sushi was pretty good compared to similar Japanese restaurants I've had in SF.
author: Bryson L.

description: best sushi place I have been to on Taraval for sure. The place is really nice inside and could almost be a high end restaurant. The only weird thing is the music they play is Dream and it is on repeat. I have been coming here for almost a year now and not once have they played something else. I kind of wonder why that is.
author: Tanya S.

description:
I've been here many times now because it's close to my house and it's open kind of late. Overall, this place is just alright.

I like to get the chicken teriyaki bento because the chicken still comes with the skin on it. My favorite roll here (and almost every sushi restaurant) is the Romeo & Juliet roll. It's salmon, avocado, and soy paper rolled with rice and topped with scallop. I usually skip the soy paper and ask them to use seaweed.

I like this place only because it's pretty cheap. The sushi is not super fresh or anything, but worth the price. And If you dine in, for every $15 you spend, you can get special deals like $1 hand rolls or $1 oysters.
author: Derek T.

description:
The food here is definelty fresh and awesome. 

I have got the daily special live amebi (the shrimp) and I have an allergic reaction on crustaceans and this place actually have fresh ones and it's delicious. I also got the live clam and it was soft and the texture just melted in my mouth. 

The service was great also very friendly and very welcoming when u get it. The atmosphere is more than a casual feel and its a great place for a dinner date out.
author: Edward T.

description: High quality sushi, good service. And always check specials!
author: Alex S.

description: I love going here. I took my GF here for her birthday a year ago and we have kept coming back at least once a month ever since. Great food and prices and a nice set-up to dine at
author: James W.

description:
Tried ordering take-out, ordered online only to get a call 15 min later that they can't deliver. Highly disappointing. 

I have eaten here before and thought the ramen was good.
author: Angelito R.

description: Very nice sushi restaurant. Great service, execution and ambience. Fresh and reasonably priced
author: Vlad K.

description:
The restaurant is nice, quiet and clean. Service was good, probably because we were the only one dinning in. It seems like a take out restaurant since most people we saw coming in were doing take outs. 

For some reason I wasn't a big fan of their food. It seems kind of bland too me and water down in a way. Not flavorful enough. Even the wasabi I had to eat a lot to get the flavor when generally a little bit can last me through the whole meal. 

It's not a bad restaurant to go from time to time but most definitely not a must go.
author: Sury C.

description: This is by far one of my favorite sushi spots in the area! Their walnut prawn shrimp roll is to die for. If you like walnut shrimp this roll will be your favorite. The place is cozy and friendly. I spend a lot of time around this area so it's great to have my favorite sushi place near by.
author: Erika S.

description: I m not living in the neighborhood but is absolutely my favorite sushi restaurant in town, I'm going there twice a month, always setting at the bar and asking to the chef to make something for me! Nice and friendly service, great food, small place as I like.
author: Davide T.

description: This place is pretty good. I really enjoyed the Mexican roll. While the fish is pretty good, my spicy tuna in the spicy tuna roll was so fishy I couldn't eat it. Bummer!
author: Amanda K.

description: We get this place almost weekly and it's delicious! All their sushi is good and their ramen is killer.
author: Mariah S.

description:
Service was quite nice. We ordered the amaebi, bento box with short ribs and 3 pieces of nigiri, lobster roll wrapped in cucumber, and the assorted sashimi 9 piece. In addition, we purchased 6 oysters for 2$ each order. Next time we will stick to the raw sashimi and rolls. Bento box was mediocre. 

Total cost was $64. Reasonable price.
author: Jensine D.

description:
Good but definitely not the best. Since they are open late, it's a good spot to get your late night sushi cravings satisfied. 

My cousin, sister and I ordered crunch California roll, hot summer roll, and four seasons roll. We also ordered the Fuji mountain roll, which came out with fire. Really amazing and quite unique! All of the sushi are pretty good but nothing spectacular. As a matter of fact, all of them are pricey and come in small portion. We also ordered spicy tuna hand roll and sashimi. They're only 1$ for every 15$ order so might as well.
 
Customer service was mediocre. There were two waitresses. One was very attentive. She refills our water and asks us often if we need anything while the other one is rude af. She took our soy sauce and gave it to other table. she also took our plates away without even asking if we're done. No smile,excuse,thank you, nothing. She seems miserable. 

I'll probably come back BUT only if I don't have any other choice to satisfy my sushi cravings. Otherwise, i would rather be in other sushi spots!
author: Mary U.

description:
*review is specifically on the sushi, will mention about the service but it does not affect my star rating. 

This place is actually not that bad, it's actually better than the Excelsior location. I am extremely picky with my sushi, and this place is definitely a place i am willing to go back when i'm having my sushi cravings while on a budget. 

I just came back from Japan and was having some sushi withdrawal symptoms, so I had to get some sushi. I had some nigiri's and the oyster and shockingly it tasted fine. Didn't smell or taste fishy at all. 

ordered nigiri's: 
Hotate
Ikura
Uni
Salmon
Walu
 
and they turned out not bad, I wasn't disappointed. And again, the oysters were not bad all. 

other orders:
seaweed salad (nothing special)
soft shell crab (again, nothing special)
gyutan skewers (not bad, flavorful but a little tough for my taste)
green tea cheese cake (i think it's frozen cheesecake)


The service here is okay, a little sloppy 
ie.
- server was confusing on explaining the menu (there's this menu where certain items becomes $1-$2 if you order a certain amount), food and drink menu. 
- server seemed to lack knowledge of the liquor selection. 
- attentiveness was BAD (had to ask for water so many times)
- they kept forgetting our order when it was not that busy at all (the server even had the time to check her phone)


Over all this place is really not bad, and the great part is they open late. 
I definitely recommend this place if you want sushi on a budget, will definitely come back here again.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: My go to sushi place since it's near and it opens late. I always get shrimp tempura roll and the lion king roll. I also like how they have their $1 specials if you spend $15 or more. I'm only knocking down one star because the service can sometimes be bad.
author: Sarah C.

description: Good experience with late night sushi! Had the mango tango roll and miso. Tasted fresh and friendly service. What more do you need? Right in the corner of 19th and Taraval. Walked from a friend's house, so very easy. Might be a bit harder to find parking.
author: Kandis P.

description:
Sushi and service was just OK! 

Pros:
Nice décor and ambience
Friendly waitresses
Wide variety of menu items
Special items less than $5 for every $15 spent
Food comes out quick
Presentable rolls
Decent portions and prices
Open until midnight every night

Cons:
Difficult parking
Service slightly slow
Food is mediocre
Forgot our $2 oysters
Had to ask 3 times for water with lemon -then finally got it but without the lemon!

Meh, I'd come back if I was only around the area!
author: Theresa P.

description: When we have dined in we've always had Excellent service. Very attentive and quick. My partner and I have only ordered speciality rolls so unsure about the rest of menu, but always delicious, nice presentation, and fresh.
author: Hilari V.

description:
Maybe I've just been spoiled by Yuki Sushi in Willow Glen, but I was just not impressed. I suppose for the price maybe it's worth it. 

My negihama roll had not one but two fish bones in it, and tasted so fishy. I never use wasabi and I had to in order to even consider eating it (and I gave up after bone #2).

The spicy tuna was mushy and I'm not sure if I'm imagining it but the rice was super salty. 

I got halfway through my food, got nauseous and gave up. :( I'm really sad, this place is super close to my new house and I thought it had potential.
author: Becky H.

description:
My favorite sushi spot in sunset district! 
Love the rock and roll eel rolls and fried avacado rolls! 

Great bento box deals and add a beer for 2$ when your bill is over 15$!

Usually do pick up, always fast and on time
author: Hunter H.

description: So I have been wanting to update this. When I wrote the last review my friend didn't tell me how she felt until after I posted this. She hated it. My roll was alright. Not the best but I liked it. Hers though, they took it back when she realized they had drizzled wasabi or something. They fixed it and brought it back real quick. What upset my friend was that they just put straight up mayonnaise as a replacement drizzle all over the roll. MAYONNAISE. She was grossed out and I told her about the scene in the movie Undercover Brother and the mayonnaise sandwich. She said that's how she felt with that roll. lol. Never going back. Not risking it.
author: Ruby S.

description:
My mom and I love this place! The staff here is so great and accommodating to all of our needs. I actually don't eat raw fish and love their ramen and udon soups. However, my mom loves their Chef Special sashimi and has never once gotten sick. The chef is so sweet and always knows what fish to cut for her (she's super picky). 

If you come here, get their garden salad. The dressing is so good! Also, they have a "spend $15 and your large hot sake is $2" deal.  I mean... AMAZING! There are other spend $15 and get something cheaper deals on the menu but the sake one is the best. 

All in all, great place. Great vibe, service and food! Oh, they deliver if you're feeling a little lazy.
author: Anastasia N.

description: This place tastes very good, friendly staff, nice atmosphere, but after returning to my car, than returning to the Sushi Raw bathroom to take care of some Sushi Raw aftermath, I saw the SUSHI CHEF not wash his hands after coming out of the bathroom. Pretty impressive. I left from here and started driving to Santa Cruz. About 30 minutes along the way I felt a rumbling in my stomach that got exponentially excruciating. It was a close call, but I made it to Santa Cruz. Three stars.
author: Dylan S.

description: This was some of the worst sushi i've ever had.. It didn't give me food poisoning, so it's getting a star for that, but that's about it. The best part of the meal was the miso soup... The rest was barely edible, and even though mine was the first delivery order (or close to it) of the evening, the food tasted like it was been prepared days ago. Everything was dry, lumpy and did not taste fresh.. From the sushi menu - toro and Albacore Belly were inedible. Salmon and yellowtail were alright. Salmon Lovers roll and fire dragon roll were barely edible.
author: Adelie P.

description:
Lunch time came around and I was craving some sushi. 

While it looks like they deliver if you're calling BEFORE 5:00pm you are out of luck. Delivery doesn't happen during lunch.

I ended up going anyway because...bento box.

I like the prices & the special dine in offers that they give. To my knowledge they've been doing it for a while now & I'm glad they do. It's a great incentive and shows customers that their patronage is appreciated. 

I got the Teriyaki Chicken bento box. Described on their website and on their menu: Chicken Teriyaki $10.99
Chicken broiled and basted with teriyaki sauce. Served with green salad, miso soup, tempura, and three pieces of sushi.

Pros: 
-The meal was served it on a platter with 4 compartments, not the traditional "box". I get it...it's a bento box. I get what I asked for. The platter however just made it more enjoyable. None of my food was hiding in the shadows. I like when it's displayed and yelling "EAT ME FIRST!"
-We were seated immediately (duh...always a pro).
-The food came quickly.
-They didn't make a big deal about splitting the check.

Cons:
-No salad like the description said.
-My chicken was dry...then drenched in teriyaki sauce that was more on the watery side.
-One server for the entire space...get the girl some help.

I'll be back!
author: Tam T.

description: Arrived today around 9pm. About 5-6 tables available so my friend and i sat down right away. 15 minuted later we signal one of the waitress since no one ever came to our table. Then received  menus and waters. Another 15-20 go by and we signal another waitress and ask if we can order our food. I ordered summer roll and my friend ordered a bento boxSo we another 20+ minutes then my friends bento box arrives. Then im not sure how much more time goes by but my friend ended up finishing her meal. I called over a waitress and ask how much longer for my order and she stated she was going to check. 15 minutes later i receive my roll. Im sure she forgot to put in my order. Food was great, service was bad. I dont think ive ever called over a waitress/waiter that many times.
author: Avelyn A.

description:
Came here one night since its conveniently located right on the big 19th avenue. I've seen this place many times, and packed too, so foodie buddy and I decided to give it a try. My friend has been here quite a few times, but certainly not his favorite place. Lots of bars are conveniently located around the corner so I noticed alot of customers were from that too. 

We ordered the tempura udon each, and a sushi roll. they do have this cheaper secret menu that you can order from once you order a certain amount of money for food, so we got the sake. 

Tempura udon: Super plain broth, just simply noodle and soup, they didnt even give us two slices of fish cakes like what other places do. The tempura came on the side with its dipping sauce...again, nothing special. I've had better. 

Sushi roll: plain as well. Very mediocre, heavy on the rice. I wasn't pleased, so I didn't order any other sushi rolls. 

Overall, very ordinary place, service is slow. I wasn't very content with the food, and given if I'm in San Francisco, I would just go elsewhere for better food. The decor is really nice inside, but I think this is an Americanized Japanese Restaurant.
author: Cindy D.

description:
I came in here last week with my roommate and our 2 friends. First and foremost the service we got was AMAZING. Our water was never less than half full, we had a server's full attention at a glance, we were given descriptive and enticing recommendations by several of the staff... 

The food was excellent; I had the spicy tuna roll and the crunch roll as well as some Nigori sake. The sake was served chilled and was the perfect temperature and the rolls were above and beyond my expectations. 

It was my first time coming here and I'm very excited to say that it has become one of my favorite sushi spots in the city. I'm already planning a second trip!
author: Jacob A.

description:
Have been coming here for years.
The prices are amazing, for every $15 spent you can get a large beer, hot sake or sashimi for $2.
Every time we go we get so much food and drink, the bill is at least 25% cheaper than any other sushi restaurant.
The food is great, always bring friends who  want to return.
The staff is very friendly the decor is nice as well.
author: diane d.

description:
Came here on a random Saturday afternoon for lunch. This place is hard to find parking here since it's on 19th and Taraval. I guess we came here for a late lunch (1pm almost 2) so the place wasn't so crowded. Gotta love how quiet the restaurant is despite the fact that it's at the intersection of two busy streets in the Sunset.

Ordered a variety of nigiri:  otoro, uni, aji, sake, waru, hotate, hamachi, and ika; also ordered two oysters for $2 from their HH menu. The oysters wasn't anything special, I believe it was the miyagi oysters from the look of the size. For such cheap pricing, I'm very happy to not find any sand in them. Bravo on the prep. Their sushi was average, with some tasting fresh and some are so-so. Their otoro that day was on point, the fattiness just melts in my mouth instantly.  Uni and sake were fresh too, no weird after taste, the colors were bright and welcoming. Maybe a bit too welcoming, I feel like I enjoyed them a bit too quickly. The others were just so-so for the quality. I've only been here once, so I can't really tell you how consistent are their sushi.

Overall, the pricing isn't that bad. Certain items are going to be market price like otoro, otherwise the nigiri are priced around $5-7 per two pieces. Not a bad price for what they serve.  Service is a bit slow, maybe the cashier area is too far from where we were seated. All in all, not bad, not bad at all.
author: Connie C.

description:
Great Place,good pricing.
Spicy Raw Tuna dish,and Hamachi Kama ere great. 
Not too crowded.
Will recommend them.
author: Katy B.

description: We were seated right away when we got there at 7pm. Customer Service was top notch because whatever we need they would bring it to us immediately. I loved their whole squid it was so juicy and chewy. Everything was really fresh, my personal favorite was their volcano roll and four seasons roll. I would definitely come back next time when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Tina C.

description:
I met a few friends here a few weekends ago. The service was amazing. We had a group of 10 and everything we ordered came out quickly and without error. 

I always order the same thing: chirashi bowl and seaweed salad with unagi. The chirashi bowl was surprisingly full and even a few dollars cheaper than other sushi restaurants in SF.

My friend ordered the Dynamite roll and it was absolutely amazing, presentation and taste. 

I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a good sushi place that's great for groups and excellent service.
author: Leona G.

description:
I don't know why there are so many bad reviews for this place. The staff is super friendly, it's cute inside and the food is yummy!

The staff always checks on you and you get your food fast. We love going here!:)
author: Em O.

description: The food is alot better.. service is better...  and it coo they are open late  for them late night cravings !..
author: jeannette L.

description:
Came in today with my friend. We sat down, looked through the menu and the male waiter that was taking our order was really rude. He did not look too happy doing his job. We asked him a couple questions regarding the menu prices, (market price)and he replied with such rude attitude.

We ordered spicy tuna roll, hot summer roll, double hamachi roll, 8 raw oysters, uni and couple other sides. The food was great, except I wish the uni tasted more fresh, that being said they do have specials. I'm not sure what day they serve the live uni, but it's to DIE FOR! It literally melts in your mouth! 

I may come back if I'm in need of some quick sushi. Other than that probably not. Our sever today (male, tall asian) was really rude, disrespectful. Unfortunately, BAD SERVICE.
author: Lena ..

description: Giving this place 4 stars because of the amazing food! Their fish is one of the freshest  fish I've ever had. Ordered the tiger roll and the salmon lover's roll. If your table buys at least 15$ worth of food you can choose to buy from a special menu that has some sweet deals. We added the 5 pieces of sake sashimi for 5$. The pieces were so fat and they melted in your mouth! The other rolls we got were also yummy. Service is kinda slow and our food took some time to come out but the staff is nice. I also liked the atmosphere. Lots of comfy seating and decorated very modern. Didn't have to wait to grab a seat. Would come here again.
author: Sami T.

description:
Love this place! Great service!
The chefs assortment on the sushi boat was amazing!!!
author: Julio S.

description: We three had the orders: house special ramen, Fuji roll, four season rolls, hand rolls, and fried chicken and tofu. I have to say it was the worst I have had in SF. No taste for all food, the roll is loosen and the fish and vege are not fresh. And there is no flavor of the ramen, how can it be called special!!!! We won't go there again:(
author: Zhi Z.

description:
I love coming here. I was really sad to see the one in San Bruno go.

The fish is always fresh, their menu changed and has way more options. Their ramen and broth is delicious as well. I don't think I have ever had a bad experience with them. This particular location is open late. I believe until midnight. Staff is friendly and prices are great. Always a fan of Sushi Raw!
author: Melissa S.

description:
The service is mediocre to none. Like everyone said the menus are thrown at you without a greet. My server didn't know what to suggest on the menu and recommend me "everything". 
The restaurant it self is clean and neat. But it take forever for your rolls to come out. 
All in all, I came to this place because it opened late, if you aren't dying to have sushi at 11pm go somewhere else and save you money.
author: Jimmy P.

description:
I just ordered delivery through EAT24 and specifically wrote to NOT ring the doorbell and to call my cell instead. The driver rang the doorbell. For various reasons, many people cannot have the doorbell be rung sometimes....sleeping baby, sleeping elderly person, dog that goes crazy, many reasons.... this was not cool.

Update: Placing another order from them. This time, I'm not gonna ask them to call my number since everyone's awake. I will admit their food is good.

Update #2: Maybe it was a mistake to order from them. 1 hour and 20 minutes in, and my delivery order is still not here. How much longer is it gonna take? For reference, I live 1.0 miles away. Ok, it took 1 hour and 30 minutes for the food to arrive on a Tuesday evening and I had to microwave the hot food because it was no longer hot.

Update #3: I placed another order on a Thursday evening. I forgot about how long the last order took, until right after I pressed the submit order button. To my pleasant surprise, my order arrived in 20 minutes this time! Food was still hot. Yay.
author: Wendy L.

description: SOOOO GOOOD. My friends took me here for my birthday and it was amazing! Every roll we ordered was great!!!! It's quaint and clean. My favorite was the lover's roll ( i wish I ordered two) and we ordered a roll that we wanted jalapenos added to it and they grilled them! GENIUS! My new favorite sushi spot!
author: Ashley O.

description: Classic menu with great presentation  and very comfortable surroundings.
author: Bruce B.

description:
Updated review, after continuing to eat in and get delivery I still adore Sushi Raw!!  

Great fish every time, the chicken udon noodle soup is now my favorite and I crave it!

The delivery is consistently on time and even arrives earlier sometimes than the estimate!
author: Ali S.

description:
Ive ordered from this place for a while a let a few things go, but my most recent experience really just set me off to advise other people to never visit this place.

I consider myself a loyal and valued customer, who unfortunately is allergic to a few things that seem to be prevalent in sushi.

I have ordered my rolls multiple times with no tobiko and no avocado(that im seriously) allergic to, and every time they have messed up wheat i requested. This would be understandable if i was ordering over the phone and there was room for misinterpretation, but over the internet via plain text, is simply unacceptable. To top this off, when we called to confirm that the got our order via phone, they were plain rude over the phone and started to insult our intelligence when began attempting to confirm what we ordered.  As an employee of a restaurant, I would actually appreciate someone calling to confirm a special order, but this establishment takes it as an insult and is rude to its customers, and then intentionally messed up the special order. 

Long story short, I used to come to this place very often, given its great reviews, but recently have taken my business elsewhere due to their vast lack of professionalism and respect for their customers.  As a repeated paying customer I deserver more thjan to be cussed at over the phone and called "stupid" for not "knowing the difference between cucumber and avocado". 

According to Sushi Raw, I "don't know the difference between soft cucumber and avocado".  If you're avocado and cucumber are interchangeable, then we definitly will not be returning.

We left Ninki due to bad service, but at least they respected our allergies.  Back to Nink iwe go.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Bad experience here, service was terrible, workers seemed unhappy. Didn't understand as it wasn't that busy.

Had Chicken Teriyaki and Tempura - Chicken was dry and tempura was soggy. Miso soup was too salty.
author: Kathryn Y.

description: The Golden Scallop roll was absolutely delicious, and great for those who don't like avocado on their rolls.
author: Madeline R.

description: Sushi was fresh and tasted fantastic. The chef takes his time making everyone, which is just fine. Every thing we ordered was awesome.
author: Paul R.

description: This place is pretty good. My friends and I attend SFSU so this place is close by Muni. The food is decently priced and good. Also, if you spend more than $20 you get a free California roll. I would recommend this place to a friend.
author: Amber K.

description:
Another Grubhub find for myself and it takes a lot to order sushi to go and they get it right.  I am a vegetarian and they have some great rolls and really good sushi salad. The order is always before the scheduled time and has never been late. 

good find for myself.
author: Debey G.

description:
I'm going to start off by saying service is so CRAPPY. And that's being nice. 

Went here over the summer with a friend of mine. Dinner time just started so there were probably 2 other parties with us. I ordered miso soup and a roll while he ordered two rolls. Both of his came out first before I even got my soup. Uhm. Really? Soup is supposed to be the first thing that comes out. Anyway, I wait. Thinking it'll come out soon.
