I keep sitting there and the waitresses are just chatting with each other so I ask one of them for my soup and I said I also ordered a roll.

She said she would bring the soup out and did so, but 20 mins later the roll NEVER CAME. I got fed up and didn't want to wait any longer even after I reminded them so we paid the bill and left a dollar tip, which was more than they deserved.

How the hell do you completely forget someone's order? Your restaurant was not even busy. Reevaluate your customer service. Never again will I eat here.
author: Cathy N.

description: Great for delivery! Always quick! Usually comes in half the time grubhub gives you. Order is always correct and everything is awesome! We love their deep fried rolls - both the eclipse roll and the Devils mountain are great. Fresh ingredients. Great costumer service - friendly delivery people. My boyfriend loves the miso soup.
author: Katie B.

description: delivered within window surprisingly good for delivery, let alone sushi. Nice work!
author: Gwen S.

description:
Was walking by this place and was starving so we ate in, forgetting my previous experience with them. I have to say, the sushi tasted much better in the restaurant! Maybe they send out old stuff or don't care about delivery? They had a deal for albacore sashimi and the pieces were huge and fresh. The gyoza was cooked perfectly. Someone at our table ordered the chicken katsu/teriyaki chicken and was later sick - not sure if it can be attributed to that though, but thought it was worth mentioning. 

The restaurant itself was clean, as was the bathroom which I always use as an indicator. 

Anyway, I'd go back here to eat in.
author: Emma M.

description:
I was very impressed w the rolls & the presentation was great! We had about 7 or 8 rolls and they were all amazing.. One after another.. The four seasons roll was off the hook! .. The hot summer roll too. 

I like my rolls big, fresh, and meaty.. 

Atmosphere: trendy, chill, quiet, modern. The place is well put together. 

Service: the waitress was very knowledgable of the menu and was great at helping us pick put some things we'd like. ... One thing I found odd was she stopped us at 4 or 5 rolls and said that would be enough.. (wtf?) .. There were 3 of us and we had just flown in from Maui and hadn't eaten in like 12 hours! We were starved. We did end up ordering 3 more rolls, but I found that to be a bit odd. ... 

The beer is ice cold and served in a frosty mug! .. Great place!! I'll definitely be back as soon as I'm in that neighborhood again
author: Jessica C.

description: was there waiting my table last night, it's not that busy but nobody come to us . They only have 2 waitress and 1 chef at sushi bar, what a strange thing, have such good business, don't even want to hire more .
author: 秀

description:
Never seems to have a bad experience in this restaurant.  One thing always appeal to me is if you spend $15 dollar they will sell you one item in their special item for $1.  So the fact that I ended just a little more to get full without wanting to spend 5-7 bucks more, this is perfect.

Anyway always enjoy the sashimi plates here and bento.  I, myself, never seems to care about rolls because they are just filler item.  I do enjoy their spicy tuna and other hand rolls.

Overall for the Sunset (under Chinese management) I truly consider this to be one of the best.  There's Okaza ya on taraval down the block and there's Fujiyama on Noriega but every place has its pros and cons.  I'm a late person and if I want to eat sushi at 11pm this place is available for me.

Give it a try next time you are feeling sushi at late hours
author: Tiffany C.

description: Surprised by some of the low reviews.  This place has some of my favorite sashimi in the bay area.  The sashimi platter is always fresh, large and delicious.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I really like sushi raw for a number of reasons. 

The service is always fast for lunch and late night, the two times I always end up at Sushi Raw.  What's better to eat at close to midnight than sushi? The only other places open late are McDonalds, diners or 7 eleven. 

Although the sushi isn't spectacular or out of this world, it does do the job and do it well. Elegant  presentation, decent portions, decent prices, complimentary green tea, its hard to complain. The bathrooms are clean and the servers are friendly. Sushi raw is successful at being a convenient sushi spot that serves fresh sushi.  

Personally, I love the salmon sashimi, the soft shell crab roll, double hamachi just to name a few.
author: Aeri S.

description:
I came here on a weekday with a few of my friends.  The waitress was nice and seated us immediately. I've been to the location in the Mission before so i have an idea of what their menu consists of. However, i prefer this location more because parking is easier and the ambiance is better here. Their plates are so cute! 

OK let me talk about the food. I ordered the Tempura Udon. the portion was pretty big. They gave me so much tempura I barely finished it. My friends ordered sushi and they all loved it. They ordered the Hot Summer Roll, lion King, and 4 other sushi rolls. Overall the food here is pretty good. Especially their presentation.  Another great sushi place in SF!
author: Belinda C.

description: They don't serve lunch on weekdays anymore; they need to update their Yelp hours.
author: Luisa T.

description: Sushi Raw has some of the most delicious oysters I've ever had. Their spicy tuna is perfectly spiced. The tuna poki is sensational! I highly recommend this restaurant if you like fresh seafood.
author: Vicky M.

description:
This review will be based on my take-out order. 

Craving for sushi, I overslept during my nap for normal sushi hours (normally before 9 pm). Woke up at 10:30 pm starving. Nothing else was on my mind but sushi, so I decided to turn to Yelp in hopes of finding a place still open! Most late-night sushi places that were 4 stars were still open were located in downtown. Not wanting to travel so far, I opted for Sushi Raw. 

Located on the corner/busy streets of 19th Ave and Taraval, I always avoided this place. Maybe cause the place seemed big outside and the sign made it seem janky. Entering, I was quite surprised. The interior looked very modern-chick with a black and red theme to it. The size of the place is quite small, so I wouldn't recommend bringing parties of 5 or more. The sign outside does no justice! Seriously, change the font, Sushi Raw. 

The service was okay, but don't expect it to be authentic sushi. I heard the chef behind the sushi counter speak Chinese. No, not rumors or reviews, like I literally heard them speak! Haha. It was nice of the server to give us water as we waited for our food. My bf and I ordered 3 sushi rolls (Taraval Street Roll, Lion King Roll, Unagi), and we ended up getting an order of California rolls for free!...or so they say. According to one yelper, for every $15 you spend, they will sell you one special item for $1. Not so bad, at least it isn't the regular price. I find it quite interesting, cause it's like you get more than what you paid for! In a way.. 

The food itself was mediocre. My bf ordered the Taraval Street Roll ($9), and he enjoyed it. He thought the rice was good, compared to other sushi restaurants; like the rice was just the right amount of stickyness. I tasted one of his rolls and it was good. I ordered (2) Unagi ($4.50 ea) and it was nothing special. Tasted like any other Unagi but it did satisfy my cravings for it. I also ordered the Lion King Roll (typical; $12), and it was good. I think out of all the LKR's I've tried, this one would be a little on the better side. I think for the quality of the food, the price is a bit pricey. 

Overall, I think this place would make a good late night place to eat if you're craving for sushi. Keep in mind, they close at midnight! They're mediocre but pricey.
author: Mandy G.

description: I love how the quality is inversely proportional to their prices, which are rock bottom.
author: Caleb O.

description:
The only initiative that brought me here was because a friend purchased a coupon from Yelp. I have passed by this place many times without giving it a second glance. I must admit that the location and outer appearance definitely knock off a point. I was surprised by the sushi though. I am in love with sushi and that is all we ate here. I love every roll we ordered. (Lion King, Dragon, Four Seasons, & Double Himachi) They also have this cool menu where you get certain things for $1-4 for every $15 you spend on food from the regular menu. 

The service was good. It was at an odd hour, like a late lunch. There were only two other parties there and we were well taken care of. I'll be back soon.
author: Tiffany P.

description: This place is GREAT! Their happy hour is glorious and the Mexican Desert Roll is fab. Highly recommend!!!
author: Danielle M.

description: Nice small place (9 table) with young traditional staff. Food is all the same as you would expect for Japanese food. My waiter was simi attentive, just enough to not bother me and my Bento box.
author: Lawrence F.

description:
Came here because I was craving some late night sushi.  I was not impressed.  All the food was just mediocre.  The service and atmosphere was fast and trendy, but I could not get over the food.  The sashimi looked like cubes of fish, not slices.  The sauce was overdone on most of the rolls.  There was only one roll I truly enjoyed.  It had lobster, crab meat, and the waitress set the plate on fire while serving it to us.  

They have pretty decent specials for every $15 you spend.
author: Edward N.

description:
Finally went to this local Sushi Raw Restaurant. And it was surprisingly good. The fish was fresh and the cut was thick.

We ordered:
*Maguro (Sashimi) 9 Pcs.: $13.95 Fresh and thick slice
*Hamachi (Sashimi) 9 Pcs.: $13.95 Fresh and thick slice
*Sushi Raw Bento Special $13.95 Choice of any 3 items listed below, served with rice, miso soup and salad. We chose Beef Teriyaki, Tonkatsu, and Short Ribs. 

Everything was fairly decent. On top of the menu, there was a special price menu. For EVERY $15 you order, you can pick one item from the Special Menu.
Special Menu had $1-2 piece raw oyster
Special Menu had $5-5 pieces of White Albacore Sashimi

Those are the two items we ordered, but there was more on the list. I am not sure when does this Special menu happen, but it made the place a better deal. And as I said again. I thought the sashimi was fairly decent.
author: Janice T.

description:
This place is amazing, I will warn you it's pretty pricey but if you like good sushi then you  will love it here.  

I recommend getting the Sunset strip roll and the Hot summer roll...all I can say is wow I can't wait to go back! 

On top of the amazing sushi was our waitress she was very attentive and when I was trying to figure out which roll I wanted to order next she offered some suggestions. I couldn't believe how fast our sushi was prepared the wait was less than 5 minutes.

And they deliver so really what are you waiting for? Ok seriously go try it now!
author: Tiffany P.

description: The food here is decent but the customer service was terrible. My friend was halfway through her large bento before I got either part of my meal. It took about 45 minutes. All I ordered was a seafood salad and one sushi roll. Her meal included sushi, plus five other items, yet that still came out MUCH earlier than mine. Someone clearly had forgotten to put in the order. There were only three other tables and two waiters, yet neither of those waiters checked in on us for the entire duration of the meal. Our water was only filled when they took our plates after we finished. I'd understand all of this happening on a busy, understaffed night, but that was not the case here.
author: Adriana N.

description: Came here last night and ordered the spicy scallop and spicy salmon hand roll. Woke up today with food poisoning and threw up twice.
author: Sergei A.

description:
Sunday, it was my privilege to attend Hiromi Fujita's acting debut on Broadway in the Lowell High School Production of "Crazy For You."  Okay so it was at Lowell High School, not on Broadway in New York but I think it was right up there with other inspired stage productions I have attended over the years.  Hiromi's song and dance in the pivotal role of "Eugene" (Hiromi was also "Pete" in The Thursday and Saturday production) was quite impressive.  Given that Hiromi is also All-City in football and the choice as MC for school events ... Did Hiromi turn out great or what?

So, proud father Yoshi, quite the accomplished sushi chef in his own right, invited me to join the family in the after play dinner.  Given that he was scheduled to drive his other daughter to Santa Cruz later, the gang opted for "Sushi Raw," and I bet you were all wondering when I was going to get to that.

Wonder no more.  Given that Fujita-san (who is opening at a new restaurant in SSF in the next month or so, details when it opens of course) is Sushi Chef All-Pro, I thought it was somewhat of a curious selection but I think it was location driven.  When we arrived, there was rock star parking across the street and this feed the  meter on Sundays thing has got to go.  It was mid to late afternoon, there was just one other couple there and yes it's quite the lengthy menu with little bonuses driven by the purchase amounts.  How so?

Well I ordered a ton katsu and tempura combination which entitled you to some tuna sashimi for a couple of bucks extra.  Then since it passed the $15 threshold, I had the option of an unagi hand roll for $1.  Service was slightly stilted but reasonably attentive.  Food was attractively presented, ton katsu was quite tender and well-fried, tempura was okay, the shrimp was kind of limp but they are good at frying foods and tempura-izing here.  The maguro sashimi was quite good, very fresh and the texture was perfect.  $20 for all of that, the rice was well-prepared and I would eat at "Sushi Raw" again.

But I am waiting for Yoshihiko Fujita's new restaurant to open ...
author: Terry A.

description:
FOOD POISONING!!
I have eaten here several times with no problems, but I am just getting over a bout of food poisoning courtesy of Sushi Raw. Any place that handles raw fish has to be super clean to avoid cross contamination of the fish and veggies with bacteria, and sushi raw is a fail. 
Yes, I am quite sure it was food poisoning and not a random virus. I've had food poisoning before and know its signs well. Buyer beware.
author: Stephanie J.

description: there are slightly mixed reviews here but i have been here twice in the past month and have loved it. i came the first time because it was close by and brought a party of 9 the next time i came. everyone was very happy with their food, great variety, and prices are not bad at all. i was here both times on week nights and it was rather empty, i also had the same waitress both times and she was fantastic. I do recommend this place!
author: Michelle H.

description: We are always welcomed with efficient service when dining in, much better than for delivery. This summer we got to enjoy the Boston Roll, which was lobster heaven. Anything we've tried at this spot has been delicious.
author: Caroline L.

description: Mediocre. Eel still had bones in it. California rolls use imitation crab meat, and a whole lot of mayonnaise (disgusting). Sesame chicken was decent, but i wasn't here for deep fried chinese food. I'm a food enthusiast and this place is cheap quality food at the price of what decent should be. I will not embarrass this place any further. I've come here twice now... Not going to give it another chance
author: Moe D.

description: The service was really slow and there wasn't even many people there. The double hamachi roll was good but we also ordered the sashimi lunch special and TMI now I've been running the bathroom. I won't be eating raw sushi from Sushi Raw anymore!
author: Jen J.

description:
Saw this place pop up where the old Hawaiian diner used to be.  Showed up on a Friday  night, and there weren't that many people in the restaurant.

We ordered too much food again as usual:
~Toro Nigiri
~Chicken Katsu, Tempura & Salmon Bento Box
~Hamachi Kama
~Live Uni
~Fuji Mountain Roll

The food was ok.  The Fuji Mountain Roll started to fall apart because there was too much sauce.  The one thing that stood out for me was the live uni.  It was my first time having live uni and it was quite delicious.

The prices are average and service was a little on the slow side.  I probably wouldn't come back for the bento box, but maybe the sushi.
author: Patra I.

description: I had just finished my maternity photo shoot and we decided to have an early dinner here since it was nearby. Good thing I wasn't super hungry because there was only one waitress and the restaurant was half full. The waitress sat us down and gave us the menus, then she came back about 5 minutes later and gave us waters. I waited for her to come back to ask her for some straws for the waters, but she did not come back for another 10minutes. The waitress kept on speed walking and dragging her feet back and forth between tables and from the back, it was a little weird. She finally came over and took our orders, and brought our straws. It took about another 20 minutes for our food to come out, and I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the salmon teriyaki rice plate ($10), and I swear when I first looked at it I thought it looked like an appetizer. The portion was tiny with a small serving of rice, two small salmon strips and salad. We were about to start eating until we realized the waitress didn't give us any forks. I understand that it's a sushi restaurant, but not everyone eats with only chopsticks, and I know that it's even harder to eat salmon with chopsticks. My boyfriend actually ended up going up to the waitress and having to ask for forks because we were just sick of sitting there and waiting for her to come back. The food was okay, I think the service just killed my whole experience there. Our bill came up to about $50 for three people (no appetizers). I'd say it wasn't worth it considering the fact that our portions were small, and I walked out still feeling a bit hungry so we ended up grabbing something else to eat.
author: Rachelle C.

description: The atmosphere was relaxing and the sushi was fresh and tasty! I had salmon and it just melted in my mouth! It was soooooo good!
author: Crystal R.

description: I am not too fond, my best friend and I came when they were about to close shop but fortunately they let us eat. The reason why Sushi Raw's name is so bold is because the food isn't what it is.
author: Shan M.

description:
Although I'm a big sushi fan, I'm not a sushi snob, which makes it very easy for Japanese restaurants to please me and get a good review out of me.

All in all, this place was decent. It's not fancy enough for a date, not cheap enough to be a feel-good, no-frills joint, and it doesn't have anything incredibly unique that would make me want to go back. The people working were nice, so I had to give them 3 stars. (I'm a sucker.)

+Atmosphere is somewhat nice for a small restaurant
+ Servers have a good understanding of the sushi making process, including what's fresh, what their restaurant specialties are, and they are good in terms of suggesting rolls
+ Open late!
= Prices are moderate. Not too exorbitant, but definitely not a super bargain.
- Rolls are very small
- Service is friendly and professional but super lax: water and tea weren't refilled often, and the rolls came out really slow for what we ordered.
author: Stephen D.

description:
I do not know why this place has an average rating of only 3 stars. In my opinion it should be AT LEAST 3.5

I have come here pretty often, both dine in, take out and delivery. Never have they gotten a delivery order wrong and I have probably ordered around 10 times. Once I came in to pick up a take out order and they had not started it yet although it was fairly dead inside but they did give me hot tea while I waited and finished it pretty promptly. 

When I have dined it they have always been fairly quick. I have never seen it very packed inside. 

The decor is nice, feels fairly classy (though I do appreciate hole in the wall establishments also) 

The fish has always been pretty fresh.
It is not the best sushi I have ever had but I would recommend it still! 

My go-to rolls are the California with thinly sliced lemon on top (YUM)
The 49er roll
and the Alaskan roll

Free hot tea is always a plus too!
author: Emily F.

description:
I always get the 3 item bento box. It comes with rice, salad and miso soup. My choices were salmon teriyaki, spicy tuna roll and tempura. Other items I've tried are:

assorted sashimi- very fresh
rainbow roll- california roll topped with fresh assorted fish
island roll- different, light and refreshing-It was wrapped with cucumber instead of seaweed and rice
california roll
goma ae- spinach in sesame sauce
author: Jo S.

description: Yum! Tempura roll, cucumber lobster roll and deep fried California roll. Tasty and fast service. We had no problems and devoured our rolls. Really surprised by all the negative reviews, definitely give this place a shot...there's also one in the Excelsior that I haven't been to recently, but enjoyed the last time I was there.
author: Kasa R.

description: Quick friendly service. Great sushi / teriyaki. Clean. Affordable. I got a lunch special bento box. Fantastic deal. 10.99 for ribeye teriyaki, tempura, miso, and a California roll.
author: Tyler S.

description:
Honestly, I pass by this place all the time while driving down 19th, and never thought to give it a second look because it's pretty meh on the outside...I assumed it was another sushi place in the city run by non-Japanese, but this place is legit. 

First, when you walk in, the swanky restaurant design instantly transforms you to a place that feels much cooler than the corner of Taraval street. There's bamboo paneling on the walls, a display of sake bottles on the wall by the sushi bar, and corrugated "made to look like metal" siding on the ceiling to give it a contemporary feel. Even the plating is artistic. 

The special rolls were so good: we had the double hamachi and the Texas "something" roll (which was wrapped in meat instead of seaweed). The menu is extensive, with offerings of everything from sushi to udon, and your standard cutlets to fresh oysters and sea urchin. They also have a special menu of happy-hour-priced small bites that you can order from each time you hit the $15 mark from the regular menu. There's a decent beer and sake selection too.
author: Lisa N.

description: By far my favorite spot for sushi in San Francisco; I truly appreciate the food decor, price, and portions, all is too close to perfection. The service sometimes a little slow but I can deal with it because of their food.
author: Natalia E.

description: I've tried sushi all of the country and sushi raw offers the best mix of expertly crafted rolls and perfectly blended dishes. I have tried about half their menu so far, and all are excellent. If you're in the area you should definitely stop by!
author: Chaid C.

description: Good udon and ramen! Service was fast and polite, dining area is clean and well maintained.
author: Tina W.

description: our server was nice but the other staff were rude. I ordered the cheesecake dessert and it was LITERALLY 5 bites worth of cheesecake! It was so small that i  almost thought they were kidding!!! The sushi was ok but unimpressive
author: Dilan F.

description:
Woohoo! Another nocturnal spot for Ninja!! =)

The sushi chef here is awesome! He loves to chat if you're seated at the counter which is the only way we dine here.  The food is good, and the service is incredible! 

We've even seen the patience the staff has for people who've come in and got completely blitzed!! Now those are probably the morons that screw us up because this establishment only serves alcohol until like 10p or 11p...BOOO!!

But Iove that they're open late and glad they are surviving the 19th and Taraval cursed spot they've taken over.  I'll continue to come support their restaurant!! =)
author: Ninja H.

description:
F*CK YOU HATERS! This place is so good to me!

Lol, I'm not one to say what's really authentic or not though, but it's good enough for me :)

My friends and I came here last night, last minute, for our friend's 24th Birthday. Our first times here.. and mmm, were we impressed!

The prices are reasonable (to me) and everything was delicious. From the salmon, to the spicy tuna, to the Philadelphia rolls. Apparently the Beef Tongue was amazing as well because the person who was sitting next to me couldn't stop talking about it!

So good! The waiters were great as well. Idk what everyone's complaining about...

I WOULD come back :)
author: Mimi N.

description: I just went to another sushi place (wont name it), and was terribly disappointed. I went to Sushi Raw multiple times and I never realized until now how much quality there was in their food preparation. They are affordable; their staff is kind and helpful. and their chef is well-experienced.
author: Remi D.

description:
Not sure what happened with the quality of food, was a bit disappointed. 

Didn't have the food dining in again this time, rather I ordered delivery. Yes, I have those lazy days, but so greatful they delivered! 

Order came in 45 minutes. Food was still warm. Received complimentary California Roll, since that's their promo when you order over a $ amount. California rolls were eh. Prices for Bento are kinda high, that's why it's more beneficial if you get the 3 item bento instead.

I guess this place is great when you order varieties of sushi rolls rather than the plates.
author: Christine F.

description:
This review is purely on the takeout of Chirashi that I had last night.  I have no idea what the food is like in the restaurant, but it did look pretty good.

I had always wanted to eat here and I saw the living social deal last night for 10 bucks off so I decided to try it.  It says 16 pieces of assorted sashimi on sushi rice on their menu.

I'm thinking wow, 13.99 sounds like a steal!  And it was, they literally stole my money with this!  I guess it didn't say how big the pieces were going to be, but I expected more than quarter sized pieces of fish.  On top of that the snapper was extremely fishy, I"m not even sure I should of eaten it.

I've had better quality fish from sushi bought from Raleys.  Thanks for ruining my night!
author: Eddie C.

description: Raw is my favorite japanese restaurant in SF. Everything is pretty fresh and so yummy!! Also, Island roll is divine!!
author: Aline A.

description:
This is the special place my mom and I go when she comes up to SF to visit. This place is great because whenever we go for lunch, no one else is really there! Its also pretty quiet, no super loud music. It seems like so many trendy sushi places nowadays sound like a club. 
But with this place, we get peace and amazing sushi.
Their specialty rolls are super good. 
the service is really good, too. We have never had a problem with anyone being rude or anything.
Overall, this is a great place for a quiet date or a nice meal with friends.
author: Marie B.

description:
This used to be my favorite place to get sushi.  Unfortunately this is the THIRD strike.  They get the takeout order wrong EVERY TIME.

My friend is allergic to avocado.  We order asking no avocado & no tobiko on anything...we specifically ask them for NO AVOCADO/NO TABIKO..what do they put?  Both! ... Every time.

How hard is it to make sushi?  Apparently they have incompetent people working the kitchen therefore we will stay away and recommend everyone who likes to get their food how they ordered it to do the same.  

Guess other places will be getting our business now!
author: Jane B.

description:
Okay, so maybe I was glamored by the opening day theatrics, but since then, I have returned multiple times and it isn't as great as I once thought.

The sushi is subpar at best and really isn't anything I would actually go to the restaurant for. The prices, if you think about it, are kind of high - $12-13 for a bento special, but you really don't get THAT much food for what you pay for... it just seems like a lot because there's a larger variety than normal on your plate. 

The only reason I would come here again is for ramen or udon. It's hard to mess those dishes up. During my most recent trip here, they've hired a great waitress (which is why the review isn't 2 stars now). She was very attentive and friendly, which is an A+ in my book.
author: Christina B.

description: Got the hot summer roll, raw oysters, edamame and a large bottle of hot sake with my table. Everything was delicious and the presentation of the food--especially the hot summer roll, was beautiful. My boyfriend and I will definitely return when craving sushi cause he lives just down the street!
author: Ally T.

description: I have been wanting to try Sushi Raw of Taraval... I finally did I came here last week just to try the Lobster Roll and the Beef Short Rib and it wasnt that bad... It was the first time for me that I have eaten the Beef Short Rib at Sushi Raw although I have eaten it before but its a first at this Sushi Raw... Also one more thing most of my yelp reviews I have described how are the restrooms... Well the restroom that I used at the Sushi Raw of Taraval was super clean although it was just for a one person but it was really clean!!!
author: William B.

description:
Food = I love sushi. the 49er roll is the best for me. Sushi is fresh. Flavorful bursts of yumminess with every bite.

Quantity = average size rolls. Not skimpy on the seafood. 

Customer service = waiters are attentive. They fill my water. Check in on me. One time I got there when they were closing (empty) cleaning up, and they served me and my company. The sushi was made with the sane attention to detail as if they weren't in a hurry to go home. Nice guys always say thank you and good bye in unison when I leave.

Atmosphere = nice. But it gets really cold and drafty. 

Bathroom = clean

Parking = street parking. It's usually available at night. 

My go to place for sushi in SF.
author: One S.

description: Might be a 2.5 star. We've done delivery here twice and they cut up the sashimi in large cubes which isn't that appetizing. I always believe in giving two chances to restaurants but I'm over this place. Decent prices. Maybe just stick with the bentos and no raw fish
author: Elisa M.

description:
Not the freshest fish. Doesnt smell or taste fresh. Seems to be pricey, which I wouldnt mind if it was great. Sushi Raw does have some redeeming qualities for me though, which keep me coming back.
1. They are close
2. They are open late and I tend to eat late. 
3. They deliver.
author: Lauren N.

description:
Look this place isnt bad but its not my first place of choice for sushi, there is just something about this place that just doesnt sit well with me. 

The service is good, the servers are all very nice and attentive. The sushi chefs know what they are doing and are also very nice. But it just might be the food, something I just can't put my finger on.

Ive been here a couple times and I've had fun, drinking and eating but the food was never GREAT, to me at least. Its a good place to fix a craving and their fish is fresh. Rolls are the usual with flares of interesting combinations but I'll add the cucumber lobster is something we have ordered almost every time.

I'll be back, I'm sure of it.
author: phillip w.

description:
Late at night this is definitely worth checking out. Open until midnite and the sushi still tasted surprisingly fresh. The downside is that it's a little overpriced. 

Place is nice and even though 19th is just outside, the atmosphere was nice and quiet inside. The sushi tasted pretty good but for the prices I kinda expected a little better. They have fatty tuna but it wasn't worth the price.

For the food alone I would probably give this place a three but the service was really quick, friendly and helpful. Our server constantly filled our tea and helped our experience. Definitely earned Sushi Raw another star.
author: James D.

description:
Average price for average sushi. The good thing? They're open until midnight... so if you have that craving for sushi late at night, this is the place to go.

The service was okay. There really wasn't anybody else in the restaurant and the waitresses kept talking to this one man. We had to flag them down for everything. There are better sushi places in the city... I would avoid this one if you can.
author: Sara K.

description:
Sushi Raw!

One Saturday night, my boyfriend and I were lazy as shit and didn't want to do anything but catch up on compilation of: 30 rock, The Office, Parks and Recreation, and Breaking Bad. After doing that, we decided that it would be an awesome idea to rewatch ALL of the Simpsons episodes.... EVER!! When we rewatched the episode with the clip "Poison Blowfish Sushi"... we knew it was a message from above.

+ Ordered togo; Orders of $25=free california roll , or $35=free dragon roll

+Seaweed salad

+Dragon roll was deliciously spicy

-/+ I think the lady on the phone misinterpreted what we wanted with our Spicy Tuna roll. Since the dragon roll already had spicy tuna, she recommended that we switch out Salmon for one of the rolls. So instead of it being Spicy Tuna roll, it was spicy salmon roll? O well, I still ate it though....

+I was poppin' the salmon roll with a thinly sliced lemon wedge on top (sorry I forgot what its called) like candy

+Open til 12am 

Conclusion: I've had better, and I've had worse. No complaints, it's the only place in the area at 11pm when hunger stikes. My belly was satisfied.
author: Julia D.

description:
Looks pricey from the outside and Yes, It's also pricey in the inside.

Food is tasty and good. Only problem to me is having to spend approximately 60-80 bucks just to get close to full for 2. Sigh

Let's put it this way...After eating here. I'm still hungry so i go to Seniore's Pizza...

That's just sad. This place simply does not impress me as much as i was hoping for.
author: Julie B C.

description: I am currently sitting here starving. Placed order for sushi at 6:18. I do not live far. They said 45-60min ok.. Now it's almost two hours later and they took their phones off the hook. My husband and I called over and over again. Last time I will order from here:(
author: Toni C.

description:
Hmmmmmm I'm a little torn about this place. The food is delicious but the service is kinda crappy! First when we walked in nobody greeted us or seated us. After standing there being ignored for a while we seated ourselves. Actually it's not just the service that's crappy, the chef didn't do such a great job either. 
We ordered the sake nigiri (salmon) which is usually delicious there. This time it came with parts of the skin on it...that's just lazy. We also ordered the red dragon roll which comes with spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, and avocado. The spicy tuna had bits of white chunks in it (not normal) and instead of avocado it had lettuce. what? The chef did offer to make us another one (after he tried to say that the avocado was in there) which was really nice but we didn't want to be wasteful so we declined. 
Usually when we go to Sushi Raw we really enjoy our experience, but this time not so much. We'll for sure go again but maybe I'll bring my own tea refills.
author: Janu A.

description:
Very fresh sushi! just a little bit overpriced.

Four Seasons roll is my favorite roll here. All the other ones are amazing and fun too. They really try to create special designs for presentation. COOL.

I've gotten the sushi boat twice so far. It's really good, but I just wish they'd switch out the california rolls. and.... its not even A BOAT!! lol it's just on a loong plate. how can you call it a sushi BOAT? =.=" 

Also had raw oysters from their special appetizer menu. really good. oysters are small and sweet. 

Tried their Udon, I rarely like udon from anywhere and this place was pretty good. I liked the clear broth and the noodles were very soft and chewy. 

Service is good.


Don't get me wrong, this is NOT my FAVORITE sushi restaurant. I would give 4.5 stars if I could.  I just really like it for a fancy night out that wont KILL your pocket like some other sushi restaurants in SF.
author: Erica L.

description: I had a splendid time today at Sushi Raw with my family. Id like to start this review off by saying how happy I was with the customer service. The waitress earned a 10 out of 10 in my book. She was very personable and friendly to us. I know yelp reviews are geared towards food most importantly but that was some of the best service I've ever received. Moreover, I ordered the sushi boat, Unagi (My favorite), and a few other very nice rolls they offered. Everything was fresh and made my taste buds go crazy! Can't wait to go back!
author: Osa A.

description:
SUSHI IN THE SUNSET!

Okay, so I have only tried a handful of places in the Sunset since moving back to SF and Sushi Raw is definitely a go.

Is it the most amazing and creative sushi joint I've been to?  No, but in that respect my heart still goes to places in LA.  But it does have fresh fish, tasty selection, and totally reasonable prices.  That alone is 4 stars in my book.

One thing I have to point out is that they have this bonus menu where you get some items for $1-$4 bucks ($5 large beer, $1 hand rolls, etc.) if you spend $15 bucks.  Kind of nice.

Downers:  
- TERRIBLE PARKING
- We happened to have drunk, high college kids (God, I sound old...) next to us who had to make everyone at the restaurant aware of their presence... suddenly you realized how small this place was AND how close our tables were.  So be aware of the crowd it draws...

Not too crowded on a Sunday night.  Good service and nice vibe overall.  Would definitely come back.
author: Christine K.

description:
this is our favorite sushi place. the sushis are perfect and they offer 2$ large hot sake, which makes life better. I totally recommend this place. the sushi and assorted sashimi taste delicious. the service is great when the restaurant is not very busy but it can lame when it is busy.
overall, Raw sushi is our spot and we hang out there, whenever we want good sushi and good service.
author: Sherry B.

description:
THE RAMEN. I've been to exclusive Ramen places who didn't make Ramen as good as here! The Tonkatsu Ramen is flavorful with perfectly cooked pork tonkatsu on top. *Salivation alert!* 

The restaurant is super clean and the service is sweet and quick. I still kind of miss the 24 hour Hawaiian drive in though :( But this will do :)
author: Adlyn S.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Mt Fuji - holy cow. It come out flaming. Great presentation. Annnnd it was pretty yummy!
2.) Rock n Roll - Basic unagi n avocado
3.) Spicy Tuna roll - yummy. but basic.


SERVICE:
Twas ok. Fail to see empty glasses or hard to make eye contact to ask for something.


ATMOSPHERE:
Always had an appealing storefront passing by on 19th. Just never wanted to stop by bc it's in the outer side of town. But it's a nice, simple atmosphere inside.
author: Angela L.

description:
I came here with my friend on a Thursday evening promptly at 5:00 p.m. (when they reopen for dinner).  The waitress was attentive, and because there was only one other family that came in to eat while we were there, even the sushi chefs at the sushi bar were able to assist us if we needed anything.  

My complaint with this place is the dirty dishes.  The first plate brought out to me had dried food stuck on it, so I promptly requested a new one.  The tea cup I was given was also not the cleanest, and I would definitely check the dishes before eating or drinking from them.  

But on to the food!  We ordered miso soup, Fuji Mountain Roll and Hot Summer Roll.  Both rolls were delicious, and I would definitely order them again.  The presentation of the rolls really makes it feel like you're eating something special.  

I would come here again, but it would not be my first choice of sushi restaurants.
author: Lydia H.

description:
Eh.. Nothing special... Overpriced... Slow service...

I hate writing poor/bad reviews... But save your money and go somewhere else... (somewhere with good food)...
author: Tiffany Y.

description: Can't wait for my favorite Texas roll. Words can not describe this place i love it all the way.
author: Alex S.

description: The atmosphere in Sushi Raw is really nice, the setting is very modern and is great for date nights with friends and family. They have a wide variety of sushi and different sized entrees. The prices were very reasonable and a good deal! The best part is that they're open till midnight for a late night bite! Would definitely go back again for sushi!
author: Lola M.

description: Well... I almost thought this place was going to be the first delivery I've ever gotten in the city that was great till they arrived so quick with the wrong order. That is why I am giving 1 star. I feel like that is the most important thing to have down before even driving out to deliver anything! I ordered 20 pieces of sushi rolls: 5 teriyaki, 5 shrimp tempura, 5 crunch roll, 5 California roll, but instead they gave me 15 California rolls and the 5 that were left were Teriyaki. Can you imagine! I was so stuffed with California rolls and plus it was my least favorite out of all the ones I ordered. I was so sad by the end of the night. But besides that their sushi is good. I recommend checking your order before that man leaves your door!
author: Yaritza F.

description:
This is one of my newest favorite place for Japanese. I believe this is a Chinese-owned Japanese restaurant, like most, but presentation is very good. I have been coming here for the past 8 months, and I am finally getting around to writing a review for this restaurant.

I usually just come here for lunches, with my coworkers, friends, and even clients at times. The place has a quiet and never packed. Everything inside looks brand new and nothing broken or worn. I have been to restaurants where it looks like the owners don't care about their interior, but this place keeps it all classy. 

The special rolls are so great. I have tried many of the rolls such as the Texas Roll, Eclipse Roll, and the Lion King Roll. The presentation of these rolls are great. I always am so amazed on how each of the rolls look when it comes to the table. 

The waitstaff is friendly and nice. Service is usually fast. I have an hour lunch, and I am never late getting back to work.
author: Jason H.

description:
I went here the other night because I had gotten home from work at 9:45  and didn't feel like eating pizza. The previous times I had been to Sushi Raw were decent enough. It didn't blow my mind and it didn't bother me at all.

My and my girlfriend walk in and sit down. 15 minutes later the server comes to greet us for the first time. Somehow I hadn't chosen what I wanted yet so we asked for a few more minutes. Much longer later (after she helped the large group next to us that just came in) she comes to us and takes our order. Oddly enough they don't sell anything alcoholic after 10 PM. This was interesting because she had just got done serving beer to two other parties in the restaurant and the sushi chef at the bar was swigging down shot after shot of weird sake concoctions with his college bros. 

When the food came it was as I remember it being, decent.

Perhaps not going here again for a while.
author: Kyle K.

description:
The convenience of Sushi Raw caught my attention. I decided to place an order online from their website, pay, and pick-up. They gave me an estimate time of picking up our food at 7:05pm. I arrived at 7:20pm and the waitress took my debit card again, swiped it, and had me pay... Little did I know I was then charged TWICE!! Why does this always happen to me?? I called back a few days later and the man on the other side wanted me to give him my debit card number again (NOONONO) and to just receive a gift card to come back and eat again for the inconvenience (NONONONO AGAIN). Sigh.

Anyways, I waited another 15 minutes to find out that my order was ready on their counter the entire time from 7:05, so the food was not fresh and my sashimi was lukewarm from the containers by 7:35. -_________- Fail.

There wasn't anything special about this place and I wasn't as satisfied as I wish I could be. The nigiri that comes with the bento box wasn't too fresh either (or it was just warmed up by the hot food it shared a container with).

Overall 2 stars and I won't be returning to this location.
author: Rosanne L.

description: Best Beef teriyaki also the walnut prawns role and the sushi boat all amazing must go take a visit again!!!
author: Ahmad O.

description:
My buddy took me out for my birthday and he decided to take me here.

We were the first ones there, the servers weren't even all there yet! Just one very sweet waitress.  She went over all the specials for the day.  We ordered every one of them.  We also ordered the sushi boat and oysters.

One of the specials we ordered was live fresh Uni. It was disgusting! It tasted like plastic and the after taste was even worse.  We thought that maybe it was just the piece we tried, so we tried another one. It was the same.  My friend told the waitress, and the head chef was so accommodating. They brought another order out and asked us to try, and if it's the same, they would not charge us.  Apparently, he knows that some uni come out tasting like that.  Thank goodness!

The oysters were kumamoto oysters...and they were perfect! Super sweet and juicy. 

Service was excellent through and through. 

Food was fresh and fresh can be. 

I will definitely come back.
author: TM O.

description:
Can there be too many sushi places in the city?

I think not.  Because apparently they just pop up non stop on each block.  Its like the next raid of Starbucks coffee shops except this time its actually food.  In any case, me and Pb had a dinner here and ordered some amazing food.  Not super great, but it definitely keeps me wanting to come back some time. 

-Fresh Uni - yUM $15 for 5 pieces 
-Toro - it ok
-Bento box - a nicely upscaled display 
-Fuji Mt - roll with lobster but overcooked.  It seemed more for show.  not worth it.
-Hamachi kama - I've been a sucker for this lately, but it was good and meaty
author: Vincent K.

description: I dont like sushi, but my wife and kids do, and they said the sushi was good.  This is the first time we went and it was sunday evening.  We were the only ones there and we were treated well.  The udon soup was very good and portion was large.  The family all said their sushi was good, and my chicken teriyaki was as good as anywhere else.  We ordered the karokke, which I had never had before, but was very good.  The family says the sushi options were also pretty extensive.  We were all happy.
author: Steven B.

description:
Right when I walked in, a table with two older men called my name "Carrie!..Carrie!" and said to each other that's Carrie and looked over to the waitress and said to her "That looks like Carrie."  I walked in clarifying that my name is Kelly... Anyways, after the confusion I was seated far away from them which is a good thing. I quickly scanned the place and it was pretty decent although once the sushi chef opened the raw fish fridge at the sushi table, I immediately smelled a stench of dead fish. 

My party arrived and we ordered like crazy. My favorite part is the unfiltered sake, Nigori. Yumm..my favorite sake. The sushi was alright..nothing special..just filling. We have the four seasons roll (presented beautifully), dynamite roll, 3 spicy tuna hand rolls (okay) , and the double hamachi roll (alright) to fill three bellies. 

Something to note.. for every $15 you spend, you can order 1 item from the dollar menu which we did (the 3 handrolls). We originally thought we could order unlimited items from the dollar menu IF you spent $15 total but it's actually 1 item every $15. 

Overall, it was a good time but would probably never come here again.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Pleasantly surprised. I am one of those weird ones that wants sushi for breakfast on Sunday's. Sunday's are one of the hard days to find a good sushi place open for lunch. Sushi raw was open when my all other regular's were closed. 

They have great lunch special prices. For every $15 you spend you get cool items for $1-2 like oysters or beer or nigiri. 

They had O-Toro and Live scallop. 

I will be back :)
author: Andrey P.

description: It seems I have judged this place too soon, I wrote my first review on my very first visit and seem to become more disappointed every following visit.
author: Sapna S.

description: I've ordered delivery from here since it's couple blocks away, really good sushi rolls I love the ones they have like the four seasons roll it's amaze balls try it you won't regret it.  Went in for pickup really nice place to dine in as well.
author: Nirea S.

description:
I wish I could love this place, it's so convenient, but alas.

Not great quality fish, definitely frozen. Service isn't great. Meh.
author: Kari G.

description:
Sushi rolls looked tasty, but I ended up going with a Bento box and was not disappointed! 

My friend and I both agreed that the 9.95 Bento was a steal, it was delicious and presented beautifully. My chicken teriyaki was perfectly cooked, the tempura was good as always and with soup, salad, a few mystery sushi bites and my $3 sake I left full AND happy. 

Our server was pleasant and helpful, although we did wait a bit for the check. 

Great location, right off the L line, windows all around. I'll be back!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Okay, so here's the deal, this is the best sushi you will ever have delivered to your house.  Period.  I have yet to ever eat better delivery sushi.  

I crave sushi, A LOT.  And its not always a good time to be going out.  So I call sushi raw.  And I am always satisfied.  

Now, is this the best sushi you will eat in your life?  Is it particularly special?  No.  But it tastes damn good, it comes to my door and if you spend $25 you get a free California roll.

Enough said.
author: Justine K.

description: Decent rolls and sake, perfect after having a few drinks at nearby bars.  The waru was very good!
author: Kate Marie G.

description:
came around 8pm on a sunday, not too busy and parked a block away. interior was smaller than I thought it would be but it was nice and cozy.

we ordered
spicy tuna roll- basic but good
tonkatsu rice plate- meh, kinda dry
taraval street roll- this i actually liked, maybe it was the cilantro but i enjoyed this one
hamachi kama- it was smushy....wasn't soft and melting...but smushy, and bf didnt like their sauce.
chirashi- decent

overall very meh, service was good though, the waitress was quick with refilling and taking away our plates.
author: Christine M.

description: ehhhhh.... this place was pretty decent... but man, the customer service was so sucky!! i swear they almost forgot to take our order. and finally after about 20 mins, the girl realized our entire group was staring at her. cool thing are the specials. if you spend $15, you can choose a special priced item off the specials menu. anyway, i'd rather go elsewhere for better service and better sushi.
author: Ann T.

description: OK, second time around we came in with out nifty yelp coupon. And while the sushi was ok we were sooooo turned off by the "four seasons roll" having so much mayo that we had to send it back (we NEVER send food back). They were nice enough to give us another roll and take the previous off the bill. But i gotta say it left a "MEH" taste in my mouth for now..
author: Michelle I.

description:
We actually seen them on grubhub.com and ordered them for delievery I was a little worried, I mean Sushi for delievery? But we tried and we have did it 3 times since then! Amazing fresh and never ever had to wait longer tthen they said fro delievery. 

Were a fan, not we just need to GO THERE one time and try it :)
author: Mark M.

description: Sushi Raw is always a great idea if you want quick and delicious Japanese food, and they deliver pretty late! They have a good amount of vegetarian options and specialty vegetarian rolls. I almost always get the bento box special- it comes with good amount of food for only $14.99. Their tofu teriyaki is pretty good, and their avocado roll is the best I've ever tried. It is so fresh and tastes AMAZING!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Decent sushi at a decent price. Isn't that what we all are looking for! Oh, it is just me?   Sushi Raw did the trick for me. They had good quality sushi and the portions were good for the price. The service was pretty good in my opinion, my glass was always full and they checked in periodically. 

The only problem I had was the location, just because it made it a little difficult to find parking if you were not lucky. But in a time where mediocre sushi is being sold at the price of gold, I will hunt out a parking spot in order to return to this gem.
author: Andrew M.

description: Apparently this restaurant closes at 2:45, not 3:00pm as stated in their information. If this is the case, you might want to turn off your neon sign outside that also indicates you are open for business. We went inside and we're only planning on getting one sushi roll with edamame for a quick bite but they turned us away. Well, you lost a customer before you even had one. Now we're eating across the street at the Vietnamese restaurant and the food is great!
author: Anon A.

description:
Never really ordered sushi for delivery!

I'm not feeling well and hungry on a Friday night.  I have not idea which restaurants around my neighborhood delivers.  I did a search and came across grubhub.com.  Pretty cool site.  You enter your addy and it give you a list of restaurants that deliver.  I random choose Sushi Raw.

I ordered a House Ramen, Dragon Roll, and Salmon Sashimi.  Some how I got an extra roll of some sort, like Calif. Roll or something (I had no idea).  Nice huh!!  :)

Any how, it wasn't bad.  Delivery arrived earlier than quoted time and thats a plus.

I would probably dine in next time to really taste a lot of there items on the menu.  Sushi is always better when you dine in.
author: Jessica P.

description: For this place we have been going for years and normally they would deserve 4 stars but today really made me completely change my mind (completely).  This evening we ordered online for pickup and was impressed by how quick my order had been completed.  Another reason is they are not busy at all and after my interaction with them today it explains everything.  When I got home we noticed that we are missing an item from our order.  I quickly called them and they kept speaking Chinese and said it is in the other box but nothing in the two boxes had unagi.  They kept speaking Chinese and even said come back and get it then (very rude).  In the background as I was talking to the person on the phone she kept asking the person in Chinese what can we do and they said it is in the box.  How hard is it to just credit my card and they just don't want to do so...worst customer service ever.  If the sushi or rolls was a bit better maybe I will give them an extra star but it wasn't...quality has been going downhill.
author: Philip W.

description:
Service is good. Been here a few times. On to the recommendations:

The lunch special: Sashimi combo is my safe bet. There's always 3 pieces of Salmon, usually 3 pieces of Tuna, and if lucky you get 3 peices of Hamachi. Other times I have gotten what looked and tasted like Albacore and it was good too. It's 9 pieces total.

What I did not care for much was the ramen and the bento box. Both were very ordinary and nothing to rave about. If you crave ramen, go to Japantown. And most places will have better bento box with larger portions and better tasting mackerel. 

I'm giving 4 stars because the fish is fresh and better than the other Japanese restaurants near my house. I'm glad Sushi Raw replaced what was once a Taqueria, and before that, it was an American Breakfast/lunch joint similar to Denny's.
author: Daniel W.

description:
Typical Chinese run Sushi joint. There's a certain characteristic with this type, and it is the opposite of authenticity, and quality. This is not to say this place severely lacks in these two areas, but if you ever had good sushi from a Japanese owned bar, you will note differences.

I love Chinese food, when it is prepared by Chinese. I love Japanese food, when it is prepared Japanese. This place (turning into a chain) is run by Chinese, and as such lacks the skill in rolling sushi (there's no demand to roll it perfect), specialty rolls are drenched in heavy sauces that masks the level of freshness of the fish, and mediocre quality sliced sashimi.  We ordered a variety of rolls, sashimi, hamachi kama, and their ramen to give a thorough test-run.

Rolls were not neatly rolled, and contained too much rice. Nothing special about any of them.

Sashimi selection were maguro, sake, and yellow tail. My issue was the maguro, as it was veiny, and therefore chewy. Sake was good, as was the yellow tail.

Hamachi kama were small, and lacked the tender freshness that I come to expect after having it so often. Later, I saw the sushi chef repack what looked to be frozen hamachi kama. Could be, or not, but it would explain why it was just okay.

The ramen. After being spoiled by Santa Ramen, and Ramen Dojo, I thought I'd have difficult time liking any other restaurant's ramen. This one just plain sucked. Broth was too sweet, ramen too soft, and the pork was just meh.

This leads me to my low expectations, and general disdain for these types of restaurants. Japanese cuisine itself commands a higher premium in cost, and therefore a higher profit margin. I just feel that Sushi Raw, and others like it are serving sushi to make the money. There is no inherent art form to sushi prep, ramen, and insistence for fresh fish. Service by the two Chinese waitresses uttering a few Japanese phrases were okay, but not great service. We decided not to come back again, and would rather walk up a block to Shi Mo for the real deal. It costs a little more, but is well worth it. 

If you are the buffet-loving type, you may give this a 4 star, since high quality isn't in your expectations. I give this place a 2.5, as the food was just meh, service was okay, and ambiance was nice, but trendy.
author: Bor C.

description: Stopped in late after a concert... Wow! Great decision. Food was so fresh and so tasty. Excellent sushi! And the house sake was amazing!
author: Amie F.

description:
we've been driving by this place for a while..I love the face that they're open late!, all sushi should be open late ya know? My boyfriend picked me up from work and took me out to sushi. 
We ordered four rolls, a bit expensive of course but they were pretty fresh and yummy.
Edemame was good and so was the miso. I don't like that face that they stand near you and stare, a little disturbing.
i'm definitely pickin this place for late night.
author: Lana K.

description:
Sushi Raw landed a good location since a lot of people travel on 19th Avenue but on the flip side, parking can be terrible for patrons.

There is nothing that really stood out to me about Sushi Raw.  The fish didn't taste fresh but it was decent.  One thing that I've been starting to appreciate is nicely cooked Japanese rice.  This place didn't have that.  The rice was a tad hard but edible. But hey, that's just my palate being picky.  The hamachi kama was a generous sized portion with lots of moist meat.  I think this was probably my favorite item that was ordered.

It's always good to try something new since you never know when you might find your next favorite joint.  It was good to try Sushi Raw but it did not leave that warm and fuzzy feeling inside that says "I can't wait to go back again."
author: Suzi K.

description:
I came to Sushi Raw for the first time when a former roomie of mine wanted to meet up here. I was skeptical at first, because the sushi selection on Taraval is not the most stellar... but she insisted that we go, and she was right!

I've been here a couple of times since then, and it's been consistently good. I've only had the rolls, and I recommend the Lion King Roll, Lover's Roll, and Four Seasons Roll. The waitresses have always been nice as well, quick to refill the tea or water and check in once in a while.
author: Min H.

description: This place has definitely changed over the last year. Whether new ownership or supply, not sure, but it is my new go-to spot. The fish is very fresh,and it's never too crowded. The seafood salad is delicious (they do it like no one else), spicy scallop role and Romeo & Juliet are my faves.
author: Emily B.

description:
Sushi was okay, but fish were all really fresh, and good service always gets me; even though they forgot my chirashi. they made my parents happy :]

green tea cheese cake *heart*
author: kim w.

description:
It turns out that this place JUST opened up so I decided to try it since I was in the area. First off, the windows are covered in a black film that makes it nearly impossible to see inside. Don't go staring into it because everyone on the inside can clearly see you. 

The restaurant has a modern theme and music to fit a lounge-like ambiance. I thought the food was about average-price for a Japanese restaurant and the service was pretty good; the waitresses - very nice.

I think the 3 selection bento boxes are worth $13.95 since there are over ten choices to choose from. The beef, beef short ribs, and sushi are all good. The tempura batter is one of the best in my opinion, I like my tempura cooked where the fried parts are flaky not the ones that are jagged and hurt when you take a bite into it. The bass was alright, I personally wouldn't order it again. The rolls are a little more expensive (around $10 each) so I didn't order any, but the next time I come, I'll try some of those.
author: Ryan L.

description: The worst service!! Our menus were tossed at us, with no hello. It was nowhere near closing, so I'm not sure why we were being treated as an inconvenience. This is the first "bad" review I've given, and it's because I feel that strongly about their poor behavior! The guy had a chip on his shoulder and made us feel uncomfortable the entire time. I will never return and I highly suggest going to another sushi spot. Their sushi is fine (defintley had better) but not at all worth the horrible service!
author: Mandy T.

description:
Ok, so I guess its only fair that I give a separate review on the service and on the food.

My girlfriends and I  had origianlly planned on going to Okazuya which was right down the street, but decided to go to Sushi Raw instead to check out the new opening. I was starving and was happy that we were immediately seated and the waitress took our order right away.

We ordered the tuna poki, which was delicious, but tuna poki is kind of hard to screw up. The hamachi kama came out next, the sauce was amazing. Our first two dishes came out in a very timely manner, however, everything else took ridiculously long. We had to wait an hour before the waitress came out with our seaweed salad. YES, AN HOUR! Seaweed salad comes already made!! All they had to do was put it on a place and bring it to our table!! Absolutely inexcuseable! When I asked the waitress about our orders, she ran to the back and checked. She came back and apologized and told us that the rest of our food would have a high priority with the chef. She was very nice and apologized many times for the mistake.

Although the food was very good (not OUTSTANDING, but still, very good) and the service would have been excellent if it wasnt for our server's error, I have to give it 2 stars because bad service at a restaurant is one of my biggest pet peeves. 

To be honest, I was iffy about whether or not Sushi Raw deserved a 2 or 3 star rating, but I decided to go with 2 starts because "Meh. I've experienced better." better suits my review.
author: Linh P.

description:
This place is ok. I came here the first time because I was excited to see a sushi restaurant on my way to Serramonte so I made a mental note to come by. 

I like rolls and the rolls that I got the first time I was here were the Four Season and Hot Summer Roll. Both were delicious. If they were only a few bucks cheaper, I'd probably come here for them more often. $12.99 for a roll... questionable... VERY questionable! 

I've come here for a few follow up visits. Service has been ok. Sitting at the bar gets you the attention you need... otherwise, start waving those arms constantly. Their lunch menu is much cheaper and it's not a bad deal. 

I'll come back when I have a craving for either the Four Season or the Hot Summer Roll but the other reviews from Yelp make me really question anything else.
author: Jeannie L.

description: The sushi is not mind-blowing. But the service is decent and their delivery is quite fast. It's good when you're in a pinch and wanting some sushi late at night.
author: Sara M.

description: This place is great! The rolls and sashimi are wonderful. The four seasons is definitely a great roll. It's taste amazing and the plating is beautifully done. I've recommended and taken people here before and they've all loved it. Must try at least once.
author: Christine H.

description: Sushi is great! And they have great deals. The service is horrible! 4 people in your restaurant and it takes me 20 minutes to place an order. Tisk tisk
author: Oliver K.

description: Love this place .. Been going to there original place in San Bruno. Love the food and good fair price
author: Scott L.

description:
We came on a Sunday night and the place was packed. This joint is new modern cozy and getting more popular every week. Being packed, the service was overwhelmed and we had to wait more than usual for our food. 

At first glance I thought the prices were cheap but I changed my mind when I realized the portions are very small. So for 3 rolls, 1 sushi order and 2 beers we paid 46 dollars. Not bad but not cheap.

What we ordered, Spicy Salmon roll good 4.95 very small portion. Shrimp tempura roll was small too and very yummy, The avocado and fried shrimp go great together. 

The most unique item was the red tuna sushi. The sushi is flame kissed so that it kills the fresh fishy flavor and gives it a very unque taste.

The best was last, the four seasons special roll. The presentation on this roll was high class and original. The special sauce was the perfect ying yang balance of spicy sweet flavors. The mix of crab, fish, and eel balanced the roll into a hearty dish. This special roll was $12 and definitaly a must have.
author: R J.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend for dinner. The service here was great and the food here is pretty good too.

We had the Lovers Roll, Rainbow Roll, Salmon Skin Roll and Saba Nigiri. The quality of the fish here are really good, so this place being pricier than other japanese restaurant is totally understandable. I think my favorite roll was the Lovers Roll, because the spicy tuna was actually spicy (some places only makes it a lil spicy). The rainbow roll was really good too because the fish was really fresh. Salmon Skin Roll was a bit too bland... and normally other places leave a lil bit of salmon meat so you can taste the salmon, but there wasnt any for this one.

This place is good, but four stars because my boyfriend can make the same thing and it will taste the same.
author: Alicia W.

description: Just like the review. Meh.. I've experienced better. The prices wasn't bad, but that's as far as it went.
author: Tommy H.

description: I went for dinner and they had some specials where you get discounted items for spending a certain amount. We decided to try the live scallop and it was fresh but quite expensive. The quality was great and ambiance was nice. Staff was attentive and made sure to take away plates when approporate and fill our tea. I would definately come back
author: Shirley Y.

description: I give them 3.5 stars. I think this place might stick around for a while. Everything that opens in thus location seems to fail, like the spot is cursed. This is the second sushi raw location I've been to now and I like both of them. The fish boat we ordered was big and good variety. The four seasons roll is the best there. The atmosphere is really nice at this location and the one on lower Haight. I will come back.
author: Karen T.

description:
The problem with many a mid-level sushi spot...
CONSISTENCY.
I went to this location once when they first opened.  V e r y  mediocre.
Then, Yelp had the $20 for $40 deal.
Been sitting on that deal for almost a year.
Stopped in today.  Had one of the most pleasantly surprising meals in a long time!
Had:
The 'live' uni.  Couldn't be better.  Sweet, creamy, briny, nutty ambrosia.
7 pc. maguro.  I was  a l m o s t  floored by the quality.  Deep, rich red.  Almost perfect firmness and elasticity.  It was very fresh, and a quality cut.
One order ikura nigiri.  High quality also.  the roe were bright, full, crisp, and not salty.
The 'live' ama ebi.  Honestly, I was hoping more for the deep fried shrimp heads, which arrived with the tobiko-topped nigiri.  Only downside to this was the tempura dashi, which was weak and served sans daikon.
Ironically enough, worst part of the meal was bowl of rice I had with the maguro and shrimp heads.  It was sitting in the cooker too long.  (i still cleaned my bowl)
A three-star overall rating...  but on this visit, at least for this guy,  five-stars all the way live!
author: Barry A.

description: Sooooooo bomb. Not only is their decor on point but the sushi is amazing ! Get the lion king roll! You'll die of how great it is! Didn't wait that long for my food either. Servers are straight to the point too ! Love that !
author: Gabriella R.

description:
It is very nice when the delivery service is exceptional so a rating can be placed just on the food.
My Ramen arrived hot, 4 stars for that alone.
I had Tonkatsu Ramen. For those of you that know ramen, YES, they serve the broth separately from the noodle and veg when delivering. The broth is creamy with some pork flavour but not overwhelming. I only had to add a touch of soy sauce. The ramen are tender, buttery and fresh. The tonkatsu was very good and crispy. A tad oily for me on normal occasion but perfect once blended with broth.
I also had the Texas Roll. I liked this roll. I am not a fan of sweet sauces and the sauce on the roll was a bit sweet for my tastes. My only other issue was the beef was not as rare as I would have liked it. Overall however, the flavours are well matched and I think you will enjoy this roll if you like beef and avocado together with a semi-sweet glaze that was not drowning the roll.
I will definitely order from Sushi Raw again.
author: emma g.

description: Sushi is ok nothing spectacular.  They offer the typical sushi varieties including maguro and salmon.  You do sometimes find some varieties like toro.  This restaurant is very similar to KiKi Sushi and Kitaro Sushi.  Also the restaurant can be pretty loud on the weekends.
author: Mike S.

description: This was the worst customer service I've ever experienced, but it wasn't entirely the waitresses fault. The food would have been mediocre if it had been brought out on time. The restaurant was staffed with one non-English speaking waitress per 50 fuming customers. Do. Not. Go. Here.
author: Henry C.

description:
I've eaten here several times now and they have not disappointed me (only when they are out of uni).

The price is reasonable for sushi - the quality is fresh.

The food is ok - I could do with just the sushi and be happy.  

some items that are good are:

Uni - the sea urchin has always been fresh!  These delicately sweet, yet taste of the ocean are pure yumminess!

Amaebi - these sweet shrimp served nigiri style comes with crunchy tempura battered head and dipping sauce to make complete!

Taraval Roll - the sweetness of the mango gives this typical shrimp tempura and imitation crab meat and eel roll a lift.

Island Roll - tuna, salmon, yellow tail wrapped in cucumber is a very refreshing take on sushi

Lobster roll - a lobster salad with mango wrapped with cucumber 

Eclipse Roll - a spicy tuna roll deep fried with cream cheese.  Beautifully presented to you in an arch with tasty artistically plated sauce

If you're in the mood for just sushi - this is the place to go to get your fill!
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
I wasn't in charge of ordering, so I can't give you the full rundown of everything that we had. Items I do remember:

-Edamame (Normal edamame--it's hard to screw up edamame after all)
-Grilled lamb chop with house sauce (Didn't have any; I don't eat lamb)
-Agedashi tofu (Not bad, not the best)
-Grilled whole squid (I like the dipping sauces that come with it)
-Tuna poki (Really good, tuna was fresh)
-Sake sashimi (My fave!)
-Red dragon roll (Not memorable)
-Lion king roll (Not as good as Sushi House's)
-Lover's roll (Not memorable)
-Hot summer roll (The only thing I remember is that it was spicy)
-Fresh uni (No offense, but it was like licking the sea floor, guh-ross! Not my thing!)
-Amaebi 
-Warm sake (Good for washing out the taste of uni)

The best was definitely the sake sashimi though our second plate was a bit frostbitten, which means it's fresh, right? Yes, service is on the slow side, but we ordered a lot of food and the place was pretty packed, so it was expected.

Oh yeah, they accidentally gave us this random roll, we ate it all before we realized it, and the waitresses never figured it out. Oops, sorry to whoever didn't get their roll!
author: Audrey T.

description:
the Prince of Taiwan's caravan has passed by this place many a times driving down 19th Ave. but i have never bothered to go inside, thinking it was just another unauthentic Japanese joint in the Sunset Area run by Chinese folk who don't know the difference between a fatty tuna and a fatty date. (Here's a hint..only one tastes good...)

My father, the King of Taiwan, decided to take the troupe here on a banging Sunday night to taste their flavors, and at first I was hesitant, but since he was paying, I thought o why not. Boy am I glad that I was wrong about this place. They are still a Chinese run operation, but these Chinese at least know what they were doing, and the food i had tonight was truly a solid, memorable experience that will have me going back for more in the near future.

Great bits:

The fresh small oysters had a great tangy, not -too -briny taste
the sashimi was pretty good and not tired.
the beef udon was really good- their broth is pretty killer.
the grilled lab chops were surprisingly good as well.
author: Jerry C.

description:
First of all, this location/place has changed businesses 3x in the past 2 years. Makes me unsure if Sushi Raw will be here much longer either after my experience...

The decision - My wife and I had vowed to continue to goto our favorite neighborhood sushi place further down the street on Taraval but this past weekend we decided to order some sushi for delivery from Sushi Raw. It was raining and we were pooped out from a long weekend of snowboarding in Tahoe. We had received a flyer in our mailbox for some specials and free delivery since we live very close so we went for it.

The order experience - I'm a big fan of technology so I went to order online, but their online menu/ordering system is painfully slow. I could have gone to the store and made my own sushi faster than ordering online. Don't do it. We decided to call in and order and pay with CC over the phone. It took my wife about 10 minutes to get the order correct, relay our CC info, and give them our address. That wasn't comforting and I wouldn't have been surprised if they got something wrong w/ the order. They quoted us 45 minutes on a Sunday night at 7:30pm for delivery. I felt that was a bit long especially since I could throw a rock and hit the place, plus I've never seen this place full/extremely busy whenever I walk by.

45 minutes came and went. I was about to call and check then there was a knock at the door, 60 minutes after placing the order. Seemed a bit long, and if that kind of time has any relation to the time it would take if we were dining in, then I will never go back.

The food - We ordered the following; Red Dragon Roll, Shrimp Tempura Roll, Lobster Roll, Tempura Appetizer, and received a free Spicy Tuna Roll. The Tempura was good, not great, and it definitely didn't help that it probably sat for several minutes getting soggy before it was sent out for delivery. The Red Dragon, Shrimp Tempura and Spicy Tuna rolls were okay, not the best I've ever had. The Lobster Roll was okay, mango and lobster don't really go together, and the cucumber wrap was so-so.  Overall the rolls were tiny, and definitely not worth the price in my opinion. Our order was over $40 for 3 rolls and an app w/ an hour wait.

The vote - I definitely won't be going back unless all my other choices for sushi are closed.  I would recommend going to get sushi from the happy people down the street at Sushi Zen if you live in the area.
author: Ryan D.

description: Left this place feeling a bit unsatisfied. Service was nice enough, but I definitely agree it's somewhat slow and hard to get the attention of the waitstaff. Plus we waited ages for the check (partly because our plates were removed so swiftly we would have had to call after her to ask for it). The food itself was pretty delicious, and we thought it was evenly priced with other sushi places in the city, but... turned out the rolls usually had six instead of the more standard eight pieces - not all of them, but most of them. So we would have ended up ordering more rolls than we normally would - but instead we went somewhere else afterward.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Great! The Menu was easy to read, good sake selection, and good pictures. 
 Nice cozy atmosphere and attentive service. 

 I had the chef choice Sashimi. It was excellent, probably the freshest sushi i have had in the area. The Spicy Tuna roll was good and all the Nigiri that i tried was also delicious. 

 It was a little pricey, but i suppose i expect sushi to be pricey. 

All and all a great place to eat.
author: Jason S.

description:
We had been here before it became Sushi Raw and was a little Mexican/Hawaii restaurant, and we were interested to see what type of change the place went under.

Upon entering we were instantly impressed. The location has always been very small, but they made the space look larger than it is and not at all crowded as it felt before. The decor is also nice and neat, while the best aspect is that, despite waiters and cooks being so close, you never feel like you are constantly "under their watching eye" while eating.

As for the food itself, it was good. We came quite hungry, so ordered a California roll and a bento special (tempura, chicken katsu and avocado rolls). The California rolls were good, although we were slightly disappointed that there wasn't eight as there was in the other sushi plates on that page. The tempura was very good.
