It had been awhile since we last had it, and were both impressed... in fact it kind of stole the show.

All in all, we were sold. The only drawback for us were the prices, which may or may not keep us from coming back. It wasn't expensive, to be clear, but there are cheaper sushi alternatives all through out SF. Still, we would be open to coming again someday.
author: Sami R.

description: Four Seasons Roll is really good, the rest is forgetable. It hits the spot but I have had way better.
author: David N.

description:
The food and the service were outstanding. Regarding the food, the flavor, texture, and presentation of each piece of nigiri, sashimi, and roll that we had were all deliciously beautiful.

The service was spot-on --- not compulsively attentive, but we were never in want for anything. This is a gem of the Sunset.
author: E. F.

description:
Good food, decent price.

The server recommended some good dishes.  Came in with a group of friends and we got a bit drunk and loud and they were real nice about it.

The sake that we had was cheap and good.  No hangover the next day! woohoo!
author: AhLin C.

description:
I noticed that a new sushi restaurant opened up on Taraval last Friday, so my friends and I ate lunch here the following day.  Because it was new, the whole place still smelled like the finishing they paint on wood to protect it.  After we were seated and got our menus, they gave us some complimentary edamane and miso soup.  

I ordered the chicken teriyaki entree/bento box for $9.95.  It came with chicken teriyaki, tempura, and 3 pieces of sushi along with rice and a bowl of salad on the side. I thought the chicken teriyaki was great - very tender and juicy as well as flavorful.  Also, the sushi tasted very fresh, it was good quality salmon, tuna, and yellowtail.  The service was responsive and I thought my meal was a good value for the quality of the food.  

My friends ordered a spicy tuna roll and tempura udon, a salmon teriyaki entree/bento, and a 49ers roll.  I got to try a piece of the spicy tuna, and it was very good.  The tempura udon was a big bowl of udon and soup, but it didn't look very appealing because it was just noodles and soup with tempura on the side.  I think they need to add some veggies or fishcake in the udon to make it more appetizing.  The 49ers roll was 8 pieces of salmon over avocado and tobiko, but the pieces were tiny.  I didn't think it was a good deal since the roll was $9.95. 

My conclusion is that the sushi is fresh and really good here, but some rolls are overpriced.  I'll probably stick with the entree/bento boxes.  Keep in mind that if you order the bento box option from the entrees menu page, it may save you a few dollars over ordering it from the bento box page.
author: Tyler C.

description:
After the whole 24 hr Fitness Pacdebacle, my homie treated me out here 

Pretty decent Japanese joint that has replaced the many restaurants near Seniores. I hope this one sticks through. This is one of the only late night sushi places around. Also this is one of the few healthy late night options.

The sushi here is decent. A bit overpriced (I'd opt to go Shimo or Okazu Ya since one has bigger cuts for the same price while the other is cheaper), but hell, its open late... 

The tuna rolls were pretty normal, but good. The fish was of good quality and the rice texture was decent. Looking at the fish in the display, those were of also good quality. My gripe is on the price of their fish, which is kind of expensive for what you're getting 

I ordered the Salmon Teriyaki rice plate while my friend ordered the Saba Shioyaki. Both are pretty much grilled fish with some rice, salad and miso.

The miso was your standard miso soup... didn't have any green onions which was sad for me, but it tasted pretty normal. Nothing amazing, but then again I've never had amazing miso soup.

The salad was whatever. Didn't care so much for the dressing on it. Tasted almost like an Italian dressing or something

The salmon and saba portions were perfect for a post work out meal or just for any person who's trying to eat right. They both were grilled nicely and lightly seasoned. The saba also did not have as fishy a flavor as other saba that I've tried, which gets plus points in my book.

The rice is also of perfect portion control.  We opted for the sushi rice because it tastes better.

Overall this place is ok. A bit overpriced for what you're getting but its an awesome late night spot to eat at for  the health conscious plus the portion control is good. I only wish they had brown rice. Since it is a healthy late night spot, I'll probably come back. However, there are better options for sushi around town if you're looking for lunch/dinner
author: Marc T.

description:
I was so surprised to see how much the place has changed since the taqueria and even the hawaiian bbq days... It's got a great ambience inside, classy and clean. Charles was the sushi chef and not only was he very knowledgeable, but very skilled! The entire staff was very welcoming and attentive. 

I'll be going back for sure!!!!!
author: B K.

description:
I was quoted that delivery would be an hour cuz they had a ton of orders to fill. They came in about 30 mins. A plus in my book.

Maybe I ordered the wrong rolls but I wasn't happy with any of them. They left out one of my orders and we tried like 10 times calling them but no one picked up. When we did get a hold of someone she didn't apologize for our missing order. She just asked if we wanted credit or for them to redeliver it. We asked for it to be redelivered and she said that we would get it when they had time. 

When I ordered sesame chicken, I was thinking of the one at Sanraku. It was nothing like that. It was breaded chicken pieces. There was a cup of spicy sauce with sesame seeds on top. Eh....it was ok.

I must say that the cod is delish! Although small in size (open palm size) it was very tasty. I think it was $7 or $9.

Will give them one more chance.

They hired my friend as a waiter and didn't even pay her for training. So she served her own tables on her own and didn't get paid tips either. Is that even legal? That just goes to show the management is hella shady. And Sushi tastes like paper. If you wsntegood Japanese food go elsewhere. This chain, especially this location is a joke.
author: Ross D.

description: Sushi is not the best but not the worst. One of the rolls I ordered i asked for no tobiko and it was covered in it. Than when taking a plate away they knocked a whole glass of water on me and didn't offer a discount or free dessert or anything, just a quick apology.
author: Jesse D.

description: Many a time I have driven up 19th Ave, rushing out to the freeway or rushing back home from the freeway, and passed this place by.  19th Ave is just a thoroughfare not really a commercial street so Sushi Raw is a bit of an anomaly. It's also close to my home so on my most recent birthday I decided to try this place out, you know eat local and whatnot.  In a nutshell, I was very pleasantly surprised by this local business. The ambiance immediately drew me in. It's got a warm sort of glow to it, the wood theme gives it a mellow vibe but with a clean Japanese aesthetic. The menu then really won me over when I saw the selection of ramen!! A sushi place which also offers ramen yay! happy dance happy dance! And not just one or two different types of ramen, but several. And boy was it good! I ended up having one special roll and ramen and it hit the spot just right. The ramen portion is also quite generous so you could share it with someone or take the rest home for another meal. AND the service was good too. What more can be said?
author: Andrea A.

description:
This place is an "A-OK" in my book.  Been here a number of times with my aunt and cousins.  It's tricky to find a place with decent sushi options and cooked meat options (because my aunt doesn't eat fish) for a decent price.  I can't say it's the first place I think of for a raw fish craving, but it's good enough as a compromise.

I've had the chirashi and their rolls, and they are all quite good.  My aunt really likes their multi-item bento, which allows her to taste multiple entrees/meats for a very reasonable price.  The one thing I wouldn't order again is their grilled squid.  It looks amazing in the picture, but is rather dry and rubbery in the version that comes to your table.
author: Fontane L.

description: amazing fresh cheap sushi, and everyone is always really nice who works there. the atmosphere is calm and cozy, love this place!
author: Chelsea V.

description: Great place. I used to live a few blocks away from this place but I had never gotten a chance to try it. Came here with a friend, we attempted to go to Sushi Bistro but that was an epic fail due to no parking. Anyways, I had a Spicy Dragon Roll. It was great! Very tasty. The cool thing about this place is the fact that they have a special menu. Every $15 that you spend , you get to select something off  their special menu which consists of $1 oysters and $2 Saki... their oysters were amazing by the way. Extremely fresh, very delicious. I would return here for sure.
author: Mariangeles C.

description:
Sashimi is fresh enough but definitely a tad overpriced.   I suppose the food is "authentic" in being Japanese by being teeny tiny and cute...  ?!

Hurray for the one parking spot in front that somehow doesn't have a meter.
author: Tokki M.

description:
Not really impressed. Prices were kind of high and the sushi wasn't anything to write home about. I think I spent like $10 on a lunch special, which I guess is standard, except that the sushi they give you for that price is pretty boring/plain -- California roll type stuff. If you want to eat anything that actually swam in the sea at one point, you've got to fork out even more, and to be honest, it's just not worth it here. 

Nice decor though.
author: Ty B.

description: I was hungry, tired, and lazy so decided to order food to pick up. I always passed by sushi raw but never ate there. Decided to try it out and ordered a red dragon roll and the bento box with beef, shrimp tempura, and salmon . It was expensive ..$34 but I was looking forward to eating it since the place looks so nice on the outside ! However, when I got home the food looked like I could have gotten it from Safeway.. Or even worse. The red dragon roll and ca roll they added looked old and not appetizing at all. The taste was worse than that. It was horrible. I feel like If I continued eating it, id get food poisoning . The salmon from the bento box was dry. The beef was gross! I only ate a bite of that. The shrimp tempura was decent. The miso soup was the only thing that kept me somewhat satisfied.  This place was really horrible ... And for someone who is not picky at all about food or any sushi and who was starving.. That means a lot. First time eating here and this will be my last. Waste of $34 .
author: Samantha T.

description: I came here with a friend not to long ago. He had been there before n had suggested it. So figured why not. I wanted to try something different although I wasnt too adventerous....I still managed a new roll to try. The Texas roll. Can I honestly say holy cow!! Sushi wrapped in thinly sliced meat. It was so surprisingly good I ate mine faster than my friend did with his own meal. Def going back. Staff was friendly n location was convenient.
author: Monica D.

description: On tuesday July 5th Damon F. and William C. went to sushi raw. We had just finished working out at the gym and were craving japanese food. When we ordered the sushi, the meat did not look fresh. The lobster roll was nothing special either as the waiter suggested. The price was also more expensive then we anticipated for 3 rolls of sushi.The fuji Mountain roll was actually enjoyable. All in all, like the movie with paris with love, when you are seeking food (or thrill) it fills your needs, but if you were to have an enjoyable dinner, I would suggest you seek elsewhere.
author: Casey N.

description:
I like it RAW.

"SUSHI RAW" that is..

Let me go on yelp, ah and it's true, Sushi Raw is OPEN for business and opened til 12am for a Sunday. I'm use to going to the larger one on Mission St.  That's what she said!! (harhar) From the outside it looks big, but once you walk in, there is a small sushi bar tucked straight ahead chairs and bench/booth along the side of the walls.  

We ordered all 3 specials they had:  

1 - raw scallop - thinly sliced scallop with lemon wedges in between with a side of deep-fried (something). yum.
2 - fresh oyster (2 pieces per order) - small but fresh. i guess size doesn't matter in this case.
3 - ahi (2 pieces per order) - cream on the inside/clean on the outside :p

We also ordered a spider roll and the famous 4 seasons roll.  Both looked good and tasted good.  The only gripe I have with the 4 seasons roll is that they use immitation crab meat. wtf?!

Also, very cramped bathroom in the back; 2 doors 1 to the front (woman) and 1 to the side (man).  Too bad there were no LED tvs and no special menu board. And boo for no alcohol after 10pm.

Plus stars for our servers!

btw: be careful of scaffolding.
author: Elliot Y.

description:
I came there with my boyfriend this week.I  found the place was nice and the service was very good. However, one thing I don't like was that the Udon soup had a lot of MSG, so after my boyfriend and I went home, both of us felt so thirsty.
Other dishes looked nice and delicious.
author: Olive S.

description:
worst japanese food experience ever.

i came here for udon on a cold night and wished to get some hot soupy udon. but they didn't have the bowl for my udon (and the place was barely filled with people), when my udon finally arrived after a 40 min wait (ridiculous), it tasted like hot salt water to me. there's not very much stuff in the udon and broth was salty beyond belief. 

my friend also got their ramen, but they didn't have 2 out of all 3 meats for the ramen my friends wanted to order. how sad.

for a restaurant to run out of meat and bowls while not having nearly enough people to occupy 1/3 of the restaurant, this is just sad
author: Joyce C.

description:
09.09.12 with 1 other

We ordered three rolls.. the lion king roll, four seasons roll and the walnut prawn roll. all of the food was very well made. i recommend them all.
also for every $15 you spend, you can get a cheap deal.. like a hand roll for $1 

the rolls were on the pricey side around $11-$13 a roll
but last year i bought a Yelp deal $20 for $40 worth of food, so of course we had to take advantage of the deal before it was expired. 

excellent service at this location. the staff were all very friendly and attentive.

a great expeience for my first time here, if i am in the area and craving sushi i would go back.
author: Jay R.

description:
Small portions and expensive! Did not tell us the price on recommendations. $22 for five pieces of UNI?? Fresh but not worth $22!!
Very slow service. Entrees came out and completed before appetizers come out! Left the restaurant not satisfied. 
Plus!!
Nice atmosphere.
Fresh food.
minus!
Expensive
Small Portions
Slow services
inexperience waitresses

Will not be going back!!
author: Michael L.

description:
This corner of 19th and Taraval felt like it has been cursed. Ever since JT's closed down, businesses that came after didn't fare very well. Now that Sushi Raw is in, perhaps this will break the spell of the cursed corner? I like to think so!

First off, Sushi Raw did one thing right. They spruced up this lot both inside and out. Looking from the outside, it's hard to tell if business is going through well with those tinted windows. Step inside and it's miles away from previous businesses. Modern look takes over and you feel like you're not in the Parkside district. Everything seem to be influenced by modern design as bento boxes are replaced by clean squared ceramic plates. 

I've tried the Bento Boxes a couple times prior to this review and I say it's a good value for the quality of the food. At around $8, you get yourself miso soup, California rolls, Shrimp and Veggie Tempura and a variety of entree options to fill in. I have to bring up an observation though. If good value to you is measured by quantity, this might be a target for the opposite. It's not the same portions as Kitaro, but this meal will fill you up. 

I've also tried the Toro, or fatty tuna, in its Niigiri form. Freshness and creamy is all that you taste and that's all you need. Or maybe it's $10 for it that you really need...

Overall, Sushi Raw is another Japanese restaurant among many that does almost the same thing as the one next door. The Bento boxes are quite a decent choice for anyone, but for the real Japanese fare, this isn't the place.
author: Jeremy L.

description: We have been going to this place at least twice a month.  Service and food has always been pretty good. Today we went there for lunch (usually we had gone there for dinner). The service was good,  but the food...  Sushimi pieces where frozen with wither frost bites or just dried up areas. My son's favorite California roll - the crab,  the rice...  He did not even finish it.  Even edamame was overcooked. It was a $56 bill and when I told them about all this,  they took a $1! off.  Needless to say we are not going there anymore. I realize that sometimes things happen,  but to take a $1 off...  Shimo has been my favorite for years as well as a couple of others that close by.
author: Igor O.

description:
Pluses are: very new modern looking interior, extraordinarily friendly sushi chefs (very outgoing Chinese group), quite reasonable prices, good selection, accomodating to special requests.

Negatives: sushi quality and presentation are better at Shimo, salad dressing is too sweet, sushi pieces are a bit on the small side, grilling needs to be done just a bit longer.

The proprietors are nice and enthusiastic, and I really like that it's open late, and it seems like it attracts a young crowd and would be a more fun place to drink, but for food alone I agree with other yelpers, I'd probably go to Shimo even though Shimo is pretty plain and standoffish.
author: p v.

description:
i'm not one to write bad reviews, but i have to say my experience at sushi raw on taraval last night really pushed me over the top.

for starters, if you like fish, DON'T eat here. the fish is NOT fresh. the tuna came out a dark dark red and was tasteless.

blah.

i feel bad because i could tell that the waitress was nice and was really trying, but i think we must have walked in during a busy time because service was held up quite a bit.

anyhow, that's all. i'm not going to sit and write a long review. i wouldn't recommend this place if you like high quality food.
author: Kyle L.

description: This place is weak . The best thing they got therewas their lamb chops. And even that wasn't cooked right. The lion king brings disappointment. It brings shame to it's name. The lion king at sushi house in alameda remains the king.I was desperate. The specialty rolls is as small as a normal roll. In addition, it did not taste that good. I was totally disappointed from this place. I will not come back to this place. If you are looking for a sushi place, you should look elsewhere. Somewhere far from here.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Best sushi ever!!! They used to have a location in san Bruno but they closed it!! Was way easier for me and my husband to go to that location. Excellent customer service, fresh sushi, great oysters!!
author: Anna S.

description: Happy hour oysters were great.  Happy hour saki got me feelin' right.  Although the presentations were beautiful, our sushi left something to be desired.  It was good (especially being drunk), but it was not 4 star sushi (and that is what I'm reviewing).  Even without dipping my rolls in the beautiful sauces, they were already drenched in other flavors and sauces (possibly to mask the flavor of shitty fish?)  When I eat sushi, I like the delicate yet complex flavors of the fish predominating, followed by the fresh veggies rolled inside.  When it is only the sauce I taste, I question the quality of what it is masking.  Overall, not bad, but not 4 or 5 (yelp review wise) sushi spot (especially with so many in the city, and close by, that are cheaper, and better).
author: Mitchell W.

description: The Chirashi is fresh, sushi rice had a nice balance to it (slightly sweet, no hint of vinegar).  The shiso that I asked to be included in my Chirashi was fresh, not wilted.  The Eclipse and Taraval rolls were a good size with a nice combination of ingredients.  I ordered take out, so, this review is based solely on food.  I'm totally up for the full dining experience!
author: Chloe G.

description:
Simply delicious!

Good services, nice atmosphere and fresh sushi.  It is a cute place to bring friends there for dinner. I am glad they turn it into a sushi place because it is hard to find moderate price and big serving sushi in sunset.  I eat a lot so if I have to paid $20 for small pieces of sushi, it won't be worthwhile for me.  I actually got full there- two of us ordered 4 rolls for about $20 each.   

I wish they can repaint their sign.  The orange just does not fit the quality of the restaurant.
author: Yau L.

description: A casual neighborhood Japanese restaurant. Food quality is pretty good for the price they charge. I like their nabe udoon and tonkazu ramen and my husband likes their assorted sashimi.
author: L K.

description: After living in Tokyo for 4 years I've enjoyed a lot of great sushi... As far as traditional sushi goes Tokyo wins hands down every time.  However, when it comes to "American sushi" Sushi Raw is putting together some great flavor combinations in there speacility rolls. I highly recommend the Pink Lady (vegetarian) or the Walnut Prawn roll. I'm yet to try a speacility roll I don't love!
author: Tyson S.

description: From the outside and location, it doesn't look like it will be a good restaurant.  Looks like a cafeteria.  But the waitress are nice.  The sashimi was fresh.  The rolls are not bad.  SF doesn't have that many good Japanese restaurants.  This is not bad at all and the surprising thing is the waitresses are Chinese!  It gets drafty if you sit near the door.  Don't sit there!
author: Byron L.

description: I'm sitting here right now.  My water glass is empty and the waitress is wiping the door down.  Its lunchtime.  At no point did the waitress or the chef smile at me.  I like smiles.  Its like a graveyard here.  Perhaps its the lunch shift.  I don't know. Food was fine, nothing spectacular.  I'm just getting my car smogged across the street.   Service gets a 2 star deduction, food 1.  Shoulda gone to the pizza place.
author: Brian B.

description:
Just got finished throwing out the meal I had delivered.  I spent almost $50 on two ramen soups and three sushi rolls.  The soup was the worst I have ever had, bar none.  Absolutuly tasteless and inedible.  It went straight into the disposall.

The sushi was passable but barely..  Shame as this place delivers and got the order right, even if the food was soooooo wrong.
author: D C.

description: Taravel? More like "terrible!" We got there at 10:00 pm on a friday night and they wouldn't serve us any alcohol! I nearly died of thirst! I felt like Tom Cruise in the beginning of "The Last Samurai." SAKE!!!! SAAAAAAKKEEEEEEE!!!!! The service was slow and the food mediocre, but being unable to wash down raw fish with delicious, sweet, nectar of the gods, rice wine and Asahi made it so much worse. Get your ish together Sushi Raw.
author: Misha M.

description:
First off, you will be surprise when you walk in because you don't expect it to look the way it looks on the inside. VERY nicely decorated and furnished. 
Came here for lunch today and it was EMPTY when we walked in for lunch. wierd because theres alot of walking traffic on that corner. Maybe its because its a sushi store chain and people are iffy about trying chains because they think of fast food joints.
We mostly had bento boxes which was 3 items for $9.95. Which is a pretty reasonable price for bento boxes. I had the beef teriyaki, chicken katsu and tempura. It tasted okay. Nothing really special. Pretty small portions though. We also had the tuna poki, pretty spicy but pretty good. It has cucumbers, white radish, raw tuna and black tobiko on top in a spicy sauce. We also had the squid leg katsu, which is basically squid legs in batter. the batter was pretty plain and not even crunchy.
For 6 people, the total was around $97. Pretty pricey for the amount of food we had! I would only come back here if it was for another lunch with work or if I really had nothing to eat because seriously, its nothing special.
author: Linda N.

description:
This location on 19th Ave has never done well with restaurants but this one looked promising.

I must start off by saying the food here is absolutely delicious! We got the bento box with teriyaki salmon, saba mackerel, yellow tail sashimi ($13.95 + $2 extra for sashimi) and a Four Seasons roll ($13) and a small Kirin beer. 

The fish is top tier. The sashimi was tender, juicy, and fresh but about 1/3 smaller cuts than your average sushi place. The salmon was grilled very well but they kinda smothered it with too much teriyaki. Still very good though. Their saba mackerel was better than I expected. 

The Four Seasons roll was to die for. The decoration of the plate was beautiful and truly art. 

Again, I thoroughly enjoyed our meal but I knocked down 1 star for the price. $36 for 2 people before tip and we didn't really get that much food. My gf was still hungry and was debating to ordered another roll but decided not to. 

I knocked down another half star because of the small cuts for their sashimi. Any legit sushi place needs to have legit sashimi. yes it tasted good but no one deserves cuts that small, especially for the price I paid. 

The place has been opened for 12 days they said and it was pretty empty for a Sat night at 8pm. It was only 2 other tables and very quiet, almost uncomfortable eating when you have 3 waitresses and 2 sushi chefs congregated talking 10 ft from you. 

Definitely glad I tried it but I probably won't be coming back due getting better value for your money at other nearby sushi spots.
author: Eddie L.

description:
Decided to go here with my roomie since there was a Yelp special of $20 for $40 worth of food.  First time here and not bad.  The waitress was really attentive and the wait for the food was great (then again we went when they just opened so that makes sense). 

Among a lot of other things, I got the Hot Summer Roll and that was pretty good although I've had bigger rolls for the same price.  There's a "discounted" menu you could order from after spending $15 or something so we got a Seaweed Salad for $2 and then a Spicy Tuna Roll for $1.

Overall, good experience here.  Can't complain since I got $20 worth of free food. :)
author: Hwan L.

description: It was better than I thought. They have the thickest sashimi I have ever seen. Very fresh.
author: Shirley Z.

description: Great tempura! Friendly staff! Convenient and open late for a late meal! Love the jalapeño roll!
author: Chanel R.

description:
came here with friends to have dinner and we got seated right away. we notice their decor was dim and well organized. 

i really like their special roll especially their all season roll cus its big and tasty however their other rolls such as, dragon roll were like bite size (very small) 

service was average. 

overall, their non special rolls sure need improvement and also all of us had to use the restroom right away after our dinner.. hmm?!
author: Valerie N.

description:
came here after work with my uncle,aunt and cousin. i'm not a big fan of sushi nor a expert so its was ok. we ordered a cali. roll and something else. 


i ordered a beef ramen. it was ok, the description of it was a little off, i could of sworn i saw it said it came with bean sprouts, and it didnt have any.didnt say anything about cabbage, which i dont like.

they dont serve alcohol after 10, luckily we came in a little before 10 to order some hot sake.
author: David M.

description: I used to pass by this place a lot when it was still a diner at this location. But Sushi Raw has done a great job in the interior. It looked modern and the ambience was good. I came with a friend and we ordered the sashimi combo, a dragon roll and a another roll (I can't remember the name). For every $15 we ordered, we can pick 1 item off the bonus menu consisiting of $1 -$5 items. The waiter said we can pick 3, so we had 2 unagi handrolls($1ea) and 1 sake sashimi ($5), which was such a good deal! The sashimi was ok fresh, not too bad. Everything else was also OK. I can't say i loved their sushi but it was not bad. Service was friendly .
author: Megum I.

description: So I finally got the chance to try this place on Saturday. It was a sushi day for my boyfriend and I before we start school. We went to masu for lunch and came here for dinner. It's a nice place and I like the setting. It felt really warm and casual. My boyfriend and I had the salmon sashimi, the taraval street roll, four season roll and the lion king. Let me tell you. These rolls are deelicious!! Oh my god! I was in heaven. :) to top that off we were still hungry so I ordered a beef udon and another four season roll for my boyfriend. Okay I know this is. Lot of food but we went with our friends so we shared some with them. Haha. The reason why I'm not giving it a 5 star (even though the food was deelish) was because they took forever on the udon and the rice plate that our friends ordered. We finished our food before the udon even came out and after. Ordered mine, it probably took another 20-30 mins to come. I understand there was a big party that night with 10+ ppl but other than that there were only our table and 2 other small ones with 3 ppl max. But overall food was good and the waitress was very deligent and apologized about the long wait and checked on the ordered very often. Thanks for the great service. :) will definitely come back!
author: Shirley Z.

description:
When they first opened, my honey and I went in for dinner and we were pleasantly surprised.  The sashimi was pretty good and cheap and the beef tongue was really really tasty!   So we ordered another beef tongue.
  
Fast forward:  What a big mistake!!!
We decided to have my boyfriend's bday party there, since we were pleasantly surprise the first time.   When we ordered some rolls for the party, they came out soggy (ewww soggy sushi rolls???  wth??)  all the flavors didn't combine well with each other, and the bill came out to be way over priced.  If we knew were going to spend that much money we would've gone somewhere else that tasted better.    One of the biggest reasons we came here was their beef tongue was a huge hit when we first came to try this place out and the sashimi wasn't too bad for the buck.  Well  the night of the bday dinner, the beef tongue was not the same nor did it taste remotely the same as before.  Did they switch chefs already?
Over all, I don't think we'll be back, I love love love sushi,  so quality and consistency is very important to me..  Hope they make it the location where they're at; a lot of business' have come and gone.
author: Paige L.

description: Okay, let me start off by saying "dont ever come here' .....I can't say the other locations are bad, but this one for sure wasn't satisfying at all. I ordered the dinner bento box with three items: spicy tuna, cali roll and beef teriyaki. They never asked me how well I wanted the meat cooked, so I assumed they were going to cook it at LEAST medium rare. When my food came out, my meat was LITERALLY RARE. WTF, am I a dog or some type of animal? What do I look like eating RARE meat? Im a little paranoid when eating anything rare, especially beef cuz my stomach is really sensitive. When I told the waitress about my meat she gave me this strange look and kind of had some attitutde. Uh...YOU WORK HERE, and I am the customer. If i'm going to be paying whatever amount at least make my food taste a little better. Don't give me a hard time for asking to cook my meat a little more. On top of that ordered a roll., and the roll was GROSS. It wasn't fresh at all, even my spicy tuna was disgusting. How hard is it to make a decent roll? Really..........I dont think i'll be coming here (at this location) ever..again.
author: Colette P.

description:
I came here the other day with my GF because we had driven past this place numerous times always saying we should try it someday.  It's been so many different restaurants we were sort of hesitant to try it due to the high turnover and the many different restaurants that have came and went, but we decided to give it a go.  It's a very cozy, modern and relaxing restaurant.  Since it's located one the busy intersection of Taraval and 19th, you'd expect to hear the traffic and be bothered but what they did was add tinted glass so no one can see inside which gives the restaurant a much better and relaxing atmosphere.  

As for the food, we received our food very promptly and the waitress came over numerous times in order to make sure we were fine and everything was to our liking.  The food was really good.  We had a couple of rolls but the one that really stood out was the Lobster Roll which was wrapped in cucumber instead of rice.  It was absolutely delicious as well as the other rolls but that was the one that really stood out.  We began with a soft shell crab and finished with a Green Tea cheesecake which was all very good.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that the location at times can be a little hard to find parking which is a minor fault but I could see some getting frustrated.  Other than that I'm probably just nit-picking but maybe the next time I go and have the same attentive service, good food and enjoyable time my rating will probably be a 5 star.  Certainly worth a look if you like Japanese and live in the area.
author: Ryan T.

description: I was very excited when I first saw the signs go up that this restaurant was going to be Sushi Raw!!!  My boyfriend and I love their restaurant on Mission and this location is even closer to my house!  I only went to this location once though since they opened and that was the night before my birthday last August ...  The food was just as wonderful as their Mission location... oysters and all!   The only drawback was their liquor license only allows them to serve until 10pm ..(this was last year, so it may have changed since).  No sake bombs for us ):  Many people came in just for drinks and were turned away... There's a bar 2 doors down... but we wanted some sake lol!   I would still definitely recommend this restaurant and their location on Mission ... Haven't tried Haight location yet, but Iam sure its delicious too!
author: Jessica C.

description:
While their sushi is good, it's not good enough to justify the unusually high prices. I took my best friend here for sushi when they first opened, and the bill for the two of us was around $60 (for two set meals and 3 rolls). As stated before, the food is good, but not THAT good. I will say that the atmosphere and aesthetic of this place are really impressive though (which helps to justify the cost if you are out on a date).

If you have a hankering for sushi, and you are not out on a date or trying to impress someone, I suggest you mosey down the block to Ninki.
author: Charlie P.

description: Although the food was good, and I thank them for being open on Christmas Eve when my friend and I went, we were told that they would not serve us alcohol. This was a little upsetting since that was in part why we went there. Later on during our dinner, to our surprise, the people that worked there pulled out a large bottle of Grey Goose, and commenced celebrating. The least they cold have done was wait 10 minutes for us to leave.Overall, good food, not too happy about them drinking in front of us, and they need to get their door fixed because it wouldn't close and it was freezing.
author: Michelle V.

description: I wish this place was closer. Parking is easy to find. Sushi is amazing. Service is great. Love their Lionking Roll.Oh and they deliver too....Hands down 5 stars. =)
author: Jasmine A.

description: This is an update on delivery time. The woman answering the phone will tell you 45 minutes, but in reality it takes about 25 to get to me.
author: Stephanie W.

description: A friend and I ordered delivery from them last night.  It took two and a half hours for them to deliver 10 blocks!  We finally gave up in frustration and called to cancelled our order - not to mention that having raw fish wait around for 2.5 hours just creeps me out.  I refused the food at the door but they still charged my credit card.
author: Shura K.

description: Review is not about sushi.... I have been there three times for lunch.    The bento box and ramen has nothing special and the plate they use make bento look like modern fusion however nothing out of ordinary.  I didn't like the service, the waitress was rushing me to order,  I thought they should respect clients and be patient... She couldn't explain some dishes.  They did not have much client and it was a Sunday, I am done with this place.
author: Z G.

description: My boyfriend and I decided to try Sushi Raw since the other sushi place (that had 4 stars) down the street had a very long wait. Luckily we were sat immediately here! Being the salmon addicts we are, we both ordered teriyaki salmon bento boxes, salmon sashimi, and salmon nigiri. We definitely overdosed on salmon that night! Anyway, the raw salmon was very fresh and delicious and so was the teriyaki salmon. However, the portions were very small for the price we paid. I only gave 2 stars because the service was HORRIBLE! We constantly had to keep flagging down a server if we needed something. No one ever checked up on us to see how we were doing or to refill our waters. We were dying of thirst! Being ignored and forgotten, we could have easily walked out on the tab and they wouldn't have even noticed, but my boyfriend and I aren't like that. When we finally got our check after asking for it twice, we tipped them very little and walked out hoping to never return again.
author: Kylie H.

description: Went here for lunch because another Sushi restaurant down the block was closed. Price was reasonable, and sushi was pretty fresh.
author: Care B.

description: I went there at 6pm on a weekday. The food was FRESH. For two of us, we ordered an order of sushi boat and a bento box. We thought the sushi boat wasn't going to make us full. It turned out we were wrong. The boat itself was good enough. I'll be back.
author: Alex S.

description:
The sushi here is decent and fresh.  The agedashi tofu wasn't so great, and neither was the ramen, but if you stick to sushi and beer, you'll do just fine here! 

Hey, that rhymes...
author: Chris C.

description: I have been here a few times before my night at my bar, Grandma's.   The service has been fast and efficient.  I get beef tongue for the app, and a happy nigri for my main course. (it comes with mi so soup and a nice salad with creamy dressing.   The fish is very fresh and delicious and the tongue is pretty scrumptious dinner.  A  great, great place for dinner before I get my drink on! n  Pretty good for folks in wheelchairs. I think a group with two or  three people in wheelchairs would work in this place.
author: Sascha B.

description: I know this place just opened but I feel that this restaurant is a wannabe sushi place. Everything seems forced and I think I heard Chinese profanity in the chaotic background.
author: Billy T.

description: Don't eat there if you have a weak stomach. I ate there with two friends who supposedly know one of the sushi chef. We got great service but if is authentic sushi you look for, this is not the place. They serve creative fresh quality grubs at slightly over price tabs but the thing that threw me over was the stomach ache those oysters gave me. Ahhh, it pains me to say I will not visit those tasty oysters at Sushi Raw ever again.
author: Sandy N.

description: I had passed by this place for years, and was pleasantly surprised when I finally tried it out.  My girlfriend and I had a great time. The specialty rolls were unique and delicious.  Also, prices were decent.  It is sooooo much nicer inside than it looks from the outside.
author: Joe L.

description:
Having a Sushi restaurant in the Bay Area means having competition all around you, and that being the case, you really need to have something that stands out from the other places. When a friend suggested that we have dinner at Sushi Raw, I was thinking, "Oh crap... another chain sushi wanna-be place." With construction outside, it didn't look too promising. However, I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in, as there was somewhat modern decor and the place was very clean (including the restroom - VERY important). It was 5 plus a kid, and we ordered a few things; Tempura Udon, 2 2-Item Bentos, Soft-Shell Crab app, 1 live Uni, 1 5-Piece order of Toro, and a app order of lamb chops(2 pieces). Nothing too extravagant, nothing too much.... Here is where the problems began... The uni was HUGE, and yes, still moving since it was a live uni, yet, as huge as the uni was, we only got 6 pieces??? Everywhere else, they give you everything inside the thing! At the market, live uni? $6, so when you pay $16 for one, you expect to get the whole thing. Second, our Toro? Not soft, stringy, and DID NOT TASTE ANYTHING LIKE TORO. The cost you ask? 5 pieces for $47!!! $25-35 depending on quality, and they charged me what?! For GARBAGE?! Sure, it can be Toro, but the grade was REALLY LOW. The lamb wasn't that good and the bentos were borderline (chicken was over cooked, and beef wasn't good even)

All in all, will not come back again. If it wasn't for the great service, I would have blown a gasket when the bill came. $198+tip was our bill for that amount of food. Over priced garbage. for what we got, I could have gone to other places for much better and fresher food for the price.
author: Jason L.

description:
came here with the boyfriend yesterday...the place is lightly dimmed and there aren't that many tables. the price is ok

got the chicken karrage-good, but nothing special
i got the summer love roll-the tuna in it was really good, but everything kept falling apart.
my bf for the fried vege roll with soy bean paper and they made it into heart shapes, but it was hard to eat b/c one u pick it up it falls apart.
(Plating is really nice)

i got the bento box-salad, miso soup, rice, tempera, seabass (looks super plain, but was so moist), and 3 pieces of nigari (the fish was super fresh, but the rice kept falling apart)
the bf got the combo bento box-short ribs, beef, and tonkasu-he said it was good, but his rice was not even sticky like how japanese rice should be

over all i'm glad i tried it, but i wouldn't come back here. the waitresses are nice, but we had alot of empty plates and they wouldn't take it away and till i asked them to. don't just stand there and look bored....do something!
author: Karen H.

description:
Had two meals delivered last night, it arrived 5 minutes after the promised delivery time but not bad for a Friday night.  Both Bento boxes were as good as it gets.
Will be using Sushi Raw again.
author: Dewi D.

description: Yea the sushi is nice and fresh, But never have i ever been treated so rudely. The site they are listed on said they would deliver to me so i made my order. Then they called me 20 minutes later saying that i lived to far and they wont deliver to me and that I had to come pick it up or they will cancel it. I ask the woman on the phone to hold on while i figure out if i want to or not and she hung up on me and i KNOW she herd me ask for her to wait. Then i tried to call back and they did not pick up the phone. I was not rude to her or short so there was no reason for her rudeness. I will never eat here again i rather spend my money were i will be treated with respect. There are plenty of better sushi places out there were you get more for your money and RESPECT. Madfish is amazing check it out!
author: Jessica H.

description: was craving for good sushi and MOUTHWATERING UNI last week and tried this place since we live few blocks away. I love the hip atmosphere. the place is nice and the servers are very friendly. I had a LIVE UNI and it was HEAVEN. Couldn't get enough of that so I ordered more. I will definitely come back.. A little on the pricey side though. But it's OK for good sushi.
author: Patty P.

description:
From the outside you can't really tell if they are open at night since they have this really dark window tint. 

The decor inside is nice and contemporary. When we went inside, there was only one other table of people. This place is pretty small since it is on 19th ave. 

The food was alright. I wasn't wow-ed by the sushi. The thing I didn't like was how much sauce they put into every dish starting from the salad! The sushi and then my beef teriyaki. They put way too much.
author: Chris Y.

description: food decent. customer service is horrible. takes me 5 mins waving em down to get more tea. I was about to call em on my phone to get service.  they were too busy chit chatting it up. didn't check on us once during our meal. im still sittin here and pretty sure they will be quick about around check time  I'd order to go but will never eat inside this joint again.  I got better service at mcd!
author: buddy p.

description: Wow, it's amazing how shitty service can completely change my mind about what used to be, an amazing restaurant. What a shame. They've hired new waitresses and new chefs who are EXTREMELY unfriendly and unwelcoming and very rude and obnoxious. I am a regular customer and literally go there every two nights and usually have our sushi rolls with slices of lemon (they're tastier this way), and the chefs somehow decided that they were sick of doing us that "favor" and started charging us an extra DOLLAR for every roll with slices of lemon! like seriously? this usually means extra $3-$4 for a whole lemon!!! Wow, talk about being greedy. Not one sushi restaurant has ever done this with me!The new chefs are always frowning and the waitresses are super snobby. NOT going back there again until their staff is changed!! VERY RUDE!
author: Sarah A.

description: Visiting my friend in sunset, I went  to this Sushi Raw with my friend. I was surprised that  the waitress(with lovely dimples) recognized me because I have dined in Sushi Raw at mission for several  times. We were recommended to have  live uni and others. My friend and I loved it. I'd  definitely order it next time. The waitress also had the soybeans on the house for us because I am their regular. SWEET!!!
author: STUSSY Dude E.

description: We got here at 7 and it was not busy at all. It's now 7:35 and we have been waiting so long for the food decided to do the review on my iPhone. There were 4 customers and 7 people working here. The workers were yapping in Chinese  and drinking Saki. The waitresses where nice but not paying attention. OK just finished eating. We thought the food was blah. I can't recommend this place but then again all the restaurants on this corner never last.  I've lived her 7 years and seen about 6 come and go.
author: Rich S.

description: Ordered a few rolls, delivery. One of them tasted really strange- maybe kind of smoky? But not like smoked salmon smoky. Just really, really off. I couldn't finish it and had to throw it out. The rest of my food was really bland. I definitely won't eat here again.
author: Brandi C.

description: I'm a sushi lover. This place.. Mmm mm mmm. Yum. =P Always busy, but never a long wait. Waitresses are polite. What not to like?
author: JUDY H.

description: This place gets a solid 4 stars for having good, fresh sush and great deals. You can order online for pickup or delivery which is super convenient but the sit down restaurant is nice as well. They have some good deals when you spend a certain amount you get a choice of free items. Would definately recommend this place to anyone looking for sushi in the area!
author: Linnea B.

description: Let's be honest.  I only came here because it was one of the few places open past 10 pm on this side of town and I was starving.  It seemed nice enough upon first glance; there was a handful of people eating (all couples).  So Dinner Date and I grabbed a table and perused the menu, settling on both getting Bento Boxes.  When the waitress brought out DD's Bento Box, she asked me, "what did you order?"  I repeated my order to her and she disappeared for 15 minutes, finally coming back with my Box in hand.  The waitress didn't even acknowledge that I'd been sitting there watching someone else eat while I waited for my food.  And I didn't get the substitution I'd asked for, but at that point I didn't want to push my luck.  The meal itself was just ok; the portions were really small and not worth the price.  Also, they stop serving alcohol here at 10pm, even though they don't close until midnight.
author: Denise K.

description: Ok here is a message to the owner. I am in the food business and know how a restaurant needs to be run. The food was good this is the most important part. Here is the catch, why spend all this money on a place and not put in heaters, the place was freezing last night and the waitresses were walking around in parkas. Just get some placement heaters for the time being. I mean DAMMNNN really no one wants to eat in an ice box. That is truly unacceptable I will be back and if you have heat i will change from 3 to 5 stars. Get it together dont put all this money into construction and then slack on the heat people want to be comfortable when they eat, now that some good free advice.
author: d m.

description: Good food and good service.  If you are a sushi fan, Sushi Raw is the place to go....
author: Breneen T.

description: The atmoshere was ok.  The food was kind of bland.  Very small portions.  I found a door hanger at my house which offered a free california roll if I spent over a certain amount so I thought I go check out the place.  Me and my wife ordered alot to make sure we went over the amount so I showed them the coupon.  To my surprise they wouldn't honor it saying that was only good for deliveries.  WTF??? DELIVER IT TO MY TABLE!  It truly boggles my mind that a place spend hundreds of dollars advertising and when it works to bring in the customer, then they treat them like shit?  Apparently I only qualified if they delivered it to my house, so we didn't get it.  I felt dumb ordering so much food just to qualify, I thought that was very foolish of them to do that to me since I'm never going back there.  They might have saved a whole buck, but they lost all my future business.  I'm a local so they really lost ALOT of potential business from me.  I would pass on this place if I were you.   It's rare for me to leave a place still hungry after dropping $40 for two people. (No booze)   I'm going back to Noriega Teriyaki, it's only 5 mins away, better service, better food, better prices, better parking.
author: Nicholas W.
